name: The Last Drop
disc: A restaurant and pub that serves some excellent dishes.
directions: It's the Kandy City Hotel's restaurant, located a few blocks from Yatinuwara Lane.

name: Breeze Beverages & Bakery
disc: A small gem in the busy Kandy streets serving some great coffee and deliciously sweet treats.
directions: It's right opposite the CIB Shopping Centre.

name: We Ai Family
disc: An authentic Chinese restaurant serving huge portions of rice and noodles.
directions: It's next to Miniso on Union Place, on your right at the roundabout.

name: Sahan Agro Strawberry Corner
disc: The Sahan Agro organic shop at Economic Center has a dessert parlour down Jambugasmulla Mawatha, Nugegoda. They dishes out a range of strawberry based snacks, drinks  and other natural products like bee honey.

name: The Bungalow - Galle Fort
disc: With its colonial elegance, comfortable accommodation, well trained staff, and the excellent food, The Bungalow - Galle Fort is a place that unites every bit of happiness that you're looking for in Galle.
address: No. 5, Church Cross Street, Galle Fort, Galle

name: Sea Breeze Seafood Restaurant
disc: Great simple Sri Lankan and fusion/international food on Hiriketiya beach.

name: Beach House
disc: Great pizza place in Hiri with rather slow service.
directions: It's on Hiriketiya Beach, right at the end of  Hiriketiya Road to your left.

name: Awanhala (Ambepussa)
disc: A pitstop to refresh yourself with a fine cup of tea on your way to Kandy.
directions: It's right at the bend in the road in Ambepussa, right after Perera and Sons.

name: The Regent Cafe
disc: A greatly underrated place serving some of the best lamprais we have had. Highly recommend you check it out!
directions: It's right at the beginning of Kynsey Road on your right.

name: Brew 1867 by Dilmah
disc: Your ideal place to grab a quick breakfast or lunch, which is both healthy and freshly made.
directions: It's right opposite Robert Senanayake building.

name: Chinese Delight
disc: Chinese Delight is one of Colombo's many, many Chinese eateries. They've got great Chinese food for an affordable price tag, with the nicest service.

name: Havi Restaurant
disc: Havi at Pannipitiya is a good spot to chill with some booze, and delicious black pepper pork.

name: Podi Hoona - The Little Gecko Luxury Campsite
disc: An incredibly beautiful luxury campsite which is a treat for eco-lovers, birdwatchers, and people who enjoy genuine rusticity.
address: Yala National Park, Kirinda - Sithulpawwa road, Thissamaharamaya

name: The Woods
disc: A beautiful cottage hotel that provides the genuine jungle experience nestled in the wilderness of Beragala.

name: Tea Blog
disc: The newest bubble tea joint in Colombo. They also do cakes, burgers, waffles and sandwiches.
address: 758A, Dr. Danister de Silva Mawatha, Colombo 09

name: Hasara Kitchen
disc: Hasara Kitchen is a popular spot in Nugegoda, that dishes out some okay rice and curry for a decent price tag.

name: Pages & Coffee
disc: A great place to sit and enjoy some organic coffee amongst loads of books.
directions: It's at the end of the lane right opposite Green Cabin on Cotta Road.

name: Cafe Sociale
disc: A retro themed cafe serving filling dishes and average coffee.
directions: It's on your left on Galle Road, right after Frankfort Place.

name: Red Orchids
disc: Great please to have a delicious Chinese, Thai dinner freely

name: Bara Beach Home
disc: bed and breakfast with cabanas on a relatively isolated patch of beach

name: Salwa Turkish Food
disc: A tiny food joint down Albert Place, Dehiwala that serves up some good street food for very cheap prices.

name: Navro Beach Restaurant
disc: Navro Beach is one of the most popular restaurants in Panadura area, if you want to have a relaxed evening with some drinks and delicious food.

name: Wayne's Junction
disc: A cafe that seems to have Australian inspired dishes, as well as local delicacies. Only on paper, as it turned out.
directions: It's on Thalawathugoda Road, past the Hokandara Food City.

name: Tokiwa Cafe
disc: Dwell Sri Lanka's Japanese inspired cafe where you can enjoy great food within a relaxed space.
directions: It's at the end of Serendib Road, right before you turn to Michaels Road.

name: Chocoholics
disc: They put chocolate on everything.

name: Tiki Cliff Top Restaurant and Bar
disc: A bar cum restaurant with a great view, great grub and the chillest vibes in Weli. What more do you need

name: Butter Boutique (Park Street Mews)
disc: Treat yourselves with decadent, delicious cakes and some of Colombo's best coffee, at Butter Boutique's newest branch at Park Street.
directions: It's at the end of the Park Street Mews alley, to your right. Right opposite The Stable.

name: Burger Q
disc: Yet another fast food joint that dishes out some ok-ish burgers and submarines for an affordable price tag.

name: Verse Collective
disc: A great spot for drinks and hangs in Hiri, food could definitely improve though

name: Pink Lotus Restaurant
disc: Pink Lotus Restaurant is one of the most popular family restaurants in Malabe area. They've got some okay Chinese food with a Sri Lankan twist.
directions: It's near the Power World gym at Malabe.

name: Cafe Noir Blanc
disc: Cafe Noir's attempt to take over Colombo's caffeine industry is slowly reaching its peak as they opened a new branch at Thimbirigasyaya. Are they good, though?
address: No. 216, Rev. Muruththettuwe Ananda Nahimi Mawatha, Colombo 5
directions: It's right at the junction on Fife Road in Thimbirigasyaya to your left.

name: Sea Food Weligama (Mama's Place) at Fishpoint Weligama
disc: But te fresh catch, wait until they make it for you and eat it on the beach!

name: Plunkett Posh Kottu
disc: Plunkett doesn't offer a significant improvement over roadside kottu, though the ambience and service are quite nice.

name: Kottulabs.lk
disc: Kottulabs.lk does some good kottu in many interesting ways. You can place your orders through their neat website, and they deliver to your doorstep.

name: Lobster Seafood Restaurant
disc: Lobster Seafood Restaurant is a hidden gem of a restaurant that serves up some really good Sri Lankanised Chinese food.

name: Ceylon Sliders (Cafe)
disc: A cafe and hangout spot in Weligama
address: No 9 New Galle Rd, Rest House Junction, Weligama, Weligama 81700

name: Iceburg
disc: Iceburg is one of the most popular spots in Maharagama that serves up some ok-ish burgers, submarines, waffles and sandwiches for a very affordable price tag.

name: The Kambury
disc: The Kambury is the latest addition to the Liberty Plaza Food Court.
address: Liberty Plaza Food Court, Liberty Plaza, Colombo 03

name: Le Papillon
disc: A multi cuisine restaurant serving some dope waffles and coffee.
address: No. 21A, Sir Ernest De Silva Mawatha, Colombo 7.
directions: The location on Gmaps is wrong. It's located on

name: Street Food Republic
disc: Street food from around the world.
directions: Right opposite the Malay Restaurant and Big Bite on the Hill Street.

name: Cafe Nuga
disc: A healthy organic spot with a wide range of delicious dishes.
directions: It's right near the junction on Ananda Coomaraswarmy Mawatha, adjoining Flower Road.

name: E-Cafe (Kollupitiya)
disc: A coffee shop down Galle Road which is only good for coffee.
directions: It's right next to Imperial College on Galle Road.

name: SkinnyTom's Deli (Bedspace) Unawatuna
disc: A great place for eats and hangs at Una

name: Kaema Laasthi
disc: A food delivery service operational in Colombo 3 and Colombo 4

name: 3x3 Granola
disc: Great granola delivered by tuk!

name: Cafe Alfred
disc: A small toast and coffee joint in Alfred House Garden.

name: Aloha Coffee Gallery Mirissa
disc: A great place for coffee and breakfast run out of a garage
address: Aloha Coffee Gallery, Sunanda Road, Mirissa

name: Ramen Misoya Colombo
disc: Ramen Misoya is Colombo's only Japanese restaurant that specializes in miso-based ramen. They've got a small menu that they nail quite well along with a surprisingly brilliant fried rice.
directions: Ramen Misoya is on the first floor of the Race Course building (right on top of McDonald's)

name: Divine (Borella)
disc: Divine at Borella serves up some ok-ish savoury items for an affordable price tag.

name: Burger Land
disc: Good place to have a little snack with an amazing lake view.

name: Abacate
disc: A little mom and pop juice bar in the Galle Fort that serves killer sandwiches, wraps and pancakes. MAN, the pancakes are the best!

name: The Heritage Cafe & Bistro
disc: A pricer dining spot with the Colonial expat experience thrown in as a bonus, the food isn't exactly fantastic.

name: River View Restaurant
disc: Great place to booze with an unbelievable food deals

name: Mainland China
disc: Colombo's latest semi-fine dining experience with authentic Chinese cuisine.
directions: It's right at the junction on Flower Road towards Ananda Coomaraswami Mawatha.

name: Hill Top Restaurant
disc: An awesome place to get booze while having delicious Chinese and Thai food.

name: Zephyr Talalla
disc: A villa-restaurant and bar affair with a great space and ambience gently, leading you into the huge and rather deserted Talalla Beach

name: Chillato
disc: A soft serve ice cream place on Battaramulla.
directions: It's near the Palan Thuna Junction, a few blocks before Bubblement. It's right next to Super Kids.

name: Napoli Artisan Pizza
disc: A brand new artisanal pizza place down Rohini Rd, Wellawatte.

name: Caramel Pumpkin
disc: The newest cafe in Cinnamon Gardens to enjoy some delicious pasta and huge slices of cheesecakes.
directions: It's right at the end of Wijerama Mawatha, towards Ward Place.

name: Lak Rasa Caterers
disc: A great place to have a good Sri Lankan & Sri Lankan Chinese meal

name: Icebair Restaurant
disc: Located right on Negombo Beach, Icebair is a pleasant restaurant to while away the time with some decent food or drinks.

name: CP's Grill
disc: CP's Grill at Nugegoda does some delicious grilled and non-grilled dishes for a decent price tag. We loved their Cheese Kottu.

name: Tea Avenue - Marine Drive
disc: A smaller cousin to their Barnes Place branch, Tea Avenue Marine Drive has the same relaxed ambience, making it a great place for meeting friends and for working along Marine Drive. The tea and food, however, were a tad underwhelming

name: Seth
disc: A popular family restaurant at Kelaniya that serves up some ok-ish food.

name: Miyon
disc: Miyon at Badulla town dishes out a range of authentic Sri Lankan cuisine. They're known for their rice and curry.

name: Nasi Lemak Corner
disc: Authentic Malay nasi lemak for delivery or pick-up
address: No 13, Mahawatte Road Embuldeniya Colombo, Sri Lanka

name: The Embazzy
disc: A cozy bistro serving excellent coffee and multi-cuisine comfort food.
directions: A few feet away from Ladies' College on Flower Road.

name: Asian Kitchen
disc: Good place to try Sri Lankan Chinese & Chopsuey.

name: The Delicacy Top
disc: Delicacy Top is one of the best places around Badulla to pop in for a bite. They've got great food for an affordable price tag, and a breathtaking view.

name: Chola Authentic Indian Restaurant
disc: Chola is a new Indian Restaurant serving some of the best Indian we have tried.
directions: It's on Lily Avenue, the byroad right after Rio Ice Cream on Marine Drive.

name: Box Colony
disc: A nice space in Battaramulla that has a big garden area as well as a quirky container box based building set up. While the service and ambiance is great, the food could use some improvement.
directions: About 100m, on your left, past Cool Planet as you approach from Thalawathugoda

name: Lounge 171
disc: Lounge 171 is the coffee house of the popular One Seven One Restaurant at Maharagama. They've got great food, good coffee and the nicest ambience.

name: K Town Bakes
disc: K Town Bakes serves up some pretty good bakery items for a fair price tag.

name: Qahwah (Almonds)
disc: Qahwah is Almonds Exclusive's own coffee station, but really it's just a part of the restaurant. There's nothing that sets it apart from the place itself other than some rather interesting coffee options.

name: Barista (Bambalapitiya)
disc: Barista is one of the first and the biggest coffee shop franchises in Colombo.

name: Kitchen 06
disc: Kitchen 06 serves up some good kottu, and rice and curry. We loved their Mix kottu.

name: Peri Peri Kukula
disc: As the name suggests, Peri Peri Kukula specialises in spicy flame-grilled chicken along with some tasty sides.
directions: On Jawatte Road, opposite KFC and Embark. You can't miss their flashy orange facade.

name: The Brown Bean Coffee (British Council)
disc: One of the icons of The Good Market since its very beginning, The Brown Bean Coffee has grown since then and has now 2 permanent outlets at the British Council and at Dialog Head Office.
directions: Inside the British Council

name: Robata Grill & Lounge (Movenpick Hotel Colombo)
disc: Robata is Movenpick's Japanese restaurant serving a range of contemporary Japanese cuisine, along with some excellent yakitori and grills.
directions: It's the shiny tall building right nex to LB Finance when you turn off Galle Road onto Colpetty Junction. Opposite the market.

name: Mama's Chicken (Liberty Plaza Food Court)
disc: Colombo's newest Fried Chicken joint.
address: Basement, Liberty Plaza, R.A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03

name: Ambul Thiyal
disc: Ambul Thiyal is a small streetside restaurant on High-level road, and does good rice and curry for cheap.  We specially love their Cuttlefish curry.

name: One Seven One
disc: One Seven One is a well known restaurant in Maharagama for quality pastries,  and rooftop dining.

name: Burger Wish
disc: Burger Wish is a new burger joint in Thalawathugoda that serves up some okay burgers for an affordable price tag.

name: Cup Cafe (Mount Lavinia)
disc: The new Cup Cafe outlet in Mount Lavinia is a good place for coffee, GOT lovers and those looking for a secluded space to unwind.

name: Machang (Pannipitya)
disc: An awesome place to get booze and a  delicious meal for a very reasonable price.

name: Anaaj
disc: Anaaj is a home-chef who specialises in authentic Pakistani Biriyani. They also have a bunch of other interesting items on their menu.
address: 4/4, Mandakini Glow, Greenlands Lane, Isipathana Mawatha, Colombo 05
directions: The address in in central Colombo a few hundred metres from Isipathana College, down Greenlands Lane.

name: Chop Chop Kottu (ODEL)
disc: Chop Chop Kottu at ODEL premises does tasty, generous kottu all day.
address: ODEL Promenade, No.02, Ward Place, Colombo 07

name: Awanhala (Navinna)
disc: Awanhala by Ceylon Hotel Corporation is a really popular food joint at Nawinna that dishes out Sri Lankan cuisine.

name: Superfood Cafe
disc: Healthy food doesn't have to be boring and Superfood Cafe is proving it with its vibrant food delivered with a good playlist in a deco magazine kind of spot.
directions: Located in Villa Raha's front yard

name: Al-Bite Restaurant
disc: An average food joint at Wellawatte that serves Biriyani, Shawarma, Submarine and the likes for a reasonable price.

name: Havi Restaurant & Bar (Thalahena)
disc: A  nice place to get booze with an antique surround.

name: Iwata By Arpico
disc: Arpico now has a sushi stand in the middle of their Hyde Park outlet and the results are well, not bad.
directions: Arpico is near Town Hall. You can enter from Union Place, or by looping around via Hyde Park Corner.

name: Spice & Curry
disc: Authentic Sri Lankan cuisine just the way we like it; spicy and filling!

name: DAVA Lounge
disc: A tiny cafe down Hampden Lane that serves some great Waffles and Hot Chocolate.

name: Jay's Kitchen (Online)
disc: Jay's Kitchen is an online food delivery service. They deliver delicious meals to your doorstep at a reasonable price.

name: Pebbles (Taj Samudra)
disc: A cosy and peaceful cafe for some coffee and croissants.
directions: From the entrance turn left and walk straight down.

name: Golden Palace (Hotel Sapphire)
disc: Golden Palace is hotel Sapphire's in-house Chinese Restaurant.
address: Hotel Sapphire, 371, Galle Road, Wellawatta, Colombo 06
directions: Hotel Sapphire is down Wellawatte next to Arethusa Lane.

name: Bubblelement (Battaramulla)
disc: Bubblelement is now open for service all the way in Battaramulla!
address: 1108 Denzil Kobbekaduwa Mawatha ,Battaramulla ( Close to the Parliament ).
directions: It's next to Wimaladharma & Sons.

name: Cafe Alfresco
disc: A cafe specialising in teas and quick bites. As the name suggests, this is mostly for outdoor dining, so it's not the best choice on a rainy day.

name: Subway (Rajagiriya)
disc: The Subway franchise has finally set up shop in Rajagiriya. It's great for people who live in the area because we don't have to haul ourselves over to boring old Colpetty for our sandwich fix.
address: No. 49/1, Sri Jayawardenepura Mawatha, Ethul Kotte, Rajagiriya
directions: It's where the old DineMore used to be. Right past the bridge onto your left.

name: Jolly Bees Restaurant
disc: One of the most popular rice and curry spots in Malabe and definitely a go-to place if you're in a budget.

name: 668 Chinese Barbecue
disc: Chinese Barbecue along with other Chinese dishes. Also BOYB.
directions: This is the top floor of the building where Mansa and 668 Sea Food resides.

name: Hebrew's Cafe
disc: Hebrew's Cafe is the newest entrant into CMB's cafe scene. They serve breakfast all day in addition to a range of sandwiches as well as coffee and smoothies.
directions: It's right next to the Rancrisp cashew shop/Fresheez  juice bar in Rajagiriya.

name: Spinner
disc: Formed by cyclists for the fitfam!
directions: Near Kibulawela bus stop, opposite Perera and Sons.

name: Almonds Exclusive
disc: Almonds is the mysterious new restaurant on Galle Road. We stopped by to see what all the hullabaloo was.
directions: It's right next to the DHL Express office on Galle Road.

name: Bubbluscious
disc: The bubbly dessert place at Ja-Ela has opened their newest outlet to Colombo 07.

name: New Summer Garden Restaurant & Guest House
disc: A nice place to get booze in the evening at beach, Cabanas with Thai & Chinese Bites.
directions: At Unawatuna diving center's beach.

name: The Food Station
disc: The Food Station at Dean's Road is a collection of foodstalls complete with a dining space. They're open 7 days a week and they're getting really popular.
address: 123 & 127 Vinyalankara Mawatha, Dean's Road Colombo 10Colombo, Sri Lanka
directions: It's on the left right as you turn into Vinyalankara Mawatha.

name: Awanhala (Colpetty)
disc: Awanhala is a restaurant down Galle Road that gets jam-packed during lunch and dinner hours.
directions: It's right next to Baskin Robbins at Kollupitiya/Colpetty.

name: Summer Set
disc: Summer Set is known for their Kottu, and is one of the places to drop into for a quick bite in Kandy.

name: Il Gelato (Uptown Kandy)
disc: Il Gelato at Uptown Kandy is a good place to end a tiresome shopping day, with some delicious, super quality ice cream.

name: Sakura Foods
disc: A nice place to have Srilankan cuisine at any time of the day.

name: Tea Lounge (Water's Edge)
disc: Tea Lounge at Water's Edge is another spawn of the Dilmah franchise. It's a little classier that the rest of their outlets in terms of ambience, but our experience wasn't a positive one.
directions: Water's Edge is right past the Diyatha Uyana onto the left side.

name: Gami Gedara (Nugegoda)
disc: Somewhere in the heart of Nugegoda, by the highway, there's a shop that serves up some amazing rice and curry. We went to check them out for lunch because why not?
address: No. 150, Piyadasa Hewavitharana Building, High Level Road, Nugegoda
directions: It's on the right side of High Level Road. Don't take the fly-over.

name: Mintage Restaurant (Galle)
disc: Good place to go with family. But not a great place to booze

name: Mad Dog's Bodega (Heritance Negombo)
disc: Hotel Heritance Negombo's bar and restaurant.
address: Heritance Negombo, 175, Lewis Place, Negombo, Sri Lanka

name: Sunway Delight (Liberty Plaza Food Court)
disc: A food joint at Liberty Plaza Food Court, with decent prices and portions. They serve rice and curry items in clay pots, which is cool.
address: No.B/4/1B, Liberty Plaza Food Court, R.A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03

name: Kumbuk Kitchen
disc: Cafe Kumbuk has taken over the cafe at the Good Market shop on the Lakpahana premises.
directions: The shop is on your immediate left inside Lakpahana grounds - Lakpahana is just opposite the Racecourse building, which is between the CCC Ground and the University of Colombo.

name: Mango Mango Indian Restaurant
disc: A decent Indian restaurant at Panadura, with quality North Indian food.

name: Ranminithenna Hotel
disc: A tiny buth kadey with home-flavored rice and curry.
directions: Take the 1st exit from the Biyagama roundabout, and stay on Biyagama Road.

name: Hondahitha - The Curd Shop
disc: Hondahitha is name synonymous with great curd around the Colombo suburbs. This is their little cafe in Kohuwala which has some great waffles for cheap.
directions: The shop is inside and at the back of the giant building that houses ODEL, Keels Super and some other stores. Just come down Dutugemunu Street. You can't miss it.

name: Pela
disc: A small buth kadey down Ven. Muruththettuwe Ananda Himi Mawatha. Quite popular, quite good.
address: 15, Ven. Muruththettuwe Ananda Himi Mawatha, Colombo
directions: From Thimbirigasyaya color lights, turn onto Ven. . Muruththettuwe Ananda Himi Mawatha.  It's just there on the left hand side.

name: Jolly's Ice Cream
disc: They serve some super authentic Sri Lankan ice cream.

name: Fifty7 (Jetwing Colombo Seven)
disc: Colombo Seven's main restaurant featuring mouthwatering fusion cuisine.
directions: Colombo Seven stands just a little way off the turn to Wijerama Mawatha.

name: Cafe La Defense
disc: The newest cafe entrant in Colombo's growing coffee shop scene.
directions: It's on Park Road, in between Udyanapura Road and Park Circus.

name: Green Mangrove River Safari and Restaurant
disc: An average restaurant with buffet lunch, takeaway and boat riding in Madu River.

name: Cravings
disc: Cravings is a cute new bakery located directly below Delifrance near Deals Place. They serve coffee and a wide variety of cakes and other baked goods.
directions: Opposite the Manhattan Fish Market.

name: Bellissima (Home Baker)
disc: Bellissima is all about desserts. You can either pick them up from Avirate Cafe or  place an order via their website!

name: Java Lounge (Fort)
disc: The Java Lounge has spawned yet another coffeeshop at Colombo 01. They still serve the same items from their menu and nothing much has changed except for the great new location.
directions: It's right behind the Dutch Hospital, straight down Hospital Lane.

name: Bacco (Negombo)
disc: An Italian restaurant on Negombo's popular hotel strip (Porutota Road).
directions: It's on the main hotel strip, look for the orange sign board.

name: Alexandra & Ward Fashion Cafe (ODEL)
disc: A multi-cuisine cafe that showcases everything from fresh seafood to Oro 1889's Neapolitan pizza.
directions: Enter the ODEL premises (Alexandra Road), and go toward the bustling promenade area. A&W is the glass structure at the end.

name: Sea Fruit Bar and Coffee Lounge
disc: Identity crisis. Is this seafood? A coffee lounge? A fruit bar?

name: Sudarshan Veg
disc: A 100%  veg restaurant serving North and South Indian food.
directions: Just turn into Frankfurt Place and you will find Sudarshan Veg. It's on the right side when turning in from Galle Road and on the left side when turning in from Marine Drive.

name: Fit Meals (Home Delivery)
disc: A new start-up delivering healthy meals to your doorstep.

name: Saffron Kitchens (Hospital Street)
disc: A cute cafe-style buth kade that serves up some amazing rice and curry at a great price.
directions: It's right down hospital street about 5 steps away from Re.Pub.Lk, behind the Dutch Hospital.

name: Chinese Dragon Cafe (Wattala)
disc: One of the better and more accessible restaurants in Wattala.
directions: If you're heading from Colombo towards Negombo, this is a little way past the Wattala Police Station and Cool Planet.

name: Simply Strawberries By Jagro (Kotte)
disc: Jagro's branch in Kotte more cozy and perfect for hangouts.
directions: It's quite difficult to miss, as soon as you turn to Ethul Kotte there's a small by road to your left.

name: Royal Cashews (Crescat)
disc: Royal Cashew is a kiosk selling cashew varying from different flavours.
address: Crescat Boulevard, 97 A,  Galle road, Colombo 03, Sri Lanka.
directions: Located at the food court, right next to Brick Lane Cookies.

name: OneUp All Day Breakfast
disc: A cozy cafe serving breakfast all day.
directions: It's located right opposite St. Peter's College on Galle Road.

name: Machang (Rella Moratuwa)
disc: Cheap, yet not-so-dodgy place to sip a beer while staring at metro coastline of  Moratuwa.
address: No 16, Lady De Soyza Road, Uyana, Moratuwa.
directions: Turn to Uyana road from Moratuwa  Cross Junction and go until you see the sea.  Turn right and Machang is around 100m along the road, to your right.

name: Kopi Kade
disc: Excellent coffee and small plates of modern Sri Lankan cuisine.
directions: Go down High Level Road and turn into Stratford Ave. It's right there on the left.

name: The Lattice (Taj Samudra)
disc: The Lattice at Taj is an informal business lounge situated on the right side of their expansive lobby as you enter. They're open from 9:00AM to 11:00PM and their Afternoon Tea session starts from 3:00PM to 6:00PM. They have an excellent menu and are reasonably priced.
address: Taj Samudra, 25 Galle Face Center Rd, Colombo 3

name: The Cricket Club Cafe
disc: The old classic at a brand new spot.
directions: It's right next to Yumi Cake.

name: Bubble Me Bubble Tea
disc: Bubble Me Bubble Tea is the newest bubble tea space in Colombo with plenty of variety when it comes to both bubbles and teas.
directions: Bubble Me is at the Thimibirigayaya junction just passed BreadTalk and Sen-Saal.

name: CityRest Fort 24/7 Ice Cream
disc: The only spot in Colombo serving ice cream 24/7/365!
directions: Located at Hospital Street, right opposite THE.RE.PUB.LK

name: Nara Thai
disc: The food is good, the portions are reasonable for the price, and you don't need to book a plane ticket to savour authentic Thai cuisine.
directions: It's located right opposite The Manhattan Fish Market down R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03.

name: Bee Beach
disc: One of the beach-side restos dotting Poruthota Road in Negombo. Bad service, great Hot Butter Cuttlefish.
directions: Turn into Poruthota Road and drive straight north, it's onto your left.

name: SUB Station
disc: A tiny fast food joint that serves food for a really low cost.
address: 297 A, Galle Road, 297 Moratuwa, Sri Lanka

name: Tori House
disc: Tori House is a quaint little cafe and store down Siebel Avenue. They've got some super home-ware, which we love.
directions: Drive along the Colombo-Batti Highway passing the Kirulapone Police Station and find Siebel Avenue onto your left. Tori's is a few metres in, also on your left.

name: Watalappan.lk
disc: A home-baker that serves a range of desserts  including Watalappan, Chocolate biscuit pudding, and Jelly custard, etc.
address: No 184/5, Devala Road, Thalangama South,Battaramulla

name: Bit Bake Bar (Arugam Bay)
disc: A seasonal little cafe in Pottuvil's popular strip.
directions: It's right next to Hideaway Villas.

name: Flamingo Restaurant (Ceylon City Hotel)
disc: Flamingo Restaurant (which has been around forever) serves up an interesting mix of cuisines ranging from Arabic, Western,  Italian and Sri Lankan.
directions: It's right down Upatissa Road, on the right hand side of Galle Road.

name: Curry Pot
disc: A buth kadey down Marine Drive in Colpetty. Quite popular, quite good.
directions: Head towards Colpetty on Marine Drive, and it's a few metres away from the Memon Hall.

name: Divine (Colpetty)
disc: A Sri Lankan bakery chain.
directions: If you're coming from Galle Road, turn into Alfred House Gardens Road, then into Alfred House Road and finally, turn left into Queen's Road.If you're coming through R.A.De Mel Mawatha, turn into Alfred House Avenue, then into Alfred House Road and finally, turn right into Queen's Road.

name: Uva Hotel
disc: A typical Saiwar place with good service and low costs.
directions: Step in to Sri Uttarananda Mawatha and at the roundabout, take the 3rd exit onto St Michaels Rd.

name: Yacht Cabin - Global Towers Hotel
disc: A budget restaurant with fine food and nice view.
address: Global Towers Hotel, 11, Station Avenue, Marine Drive, Wellawatta, Colombo 06
directions: Located right in the middle of KFC, Marine Drive and Global Towers Hotel.

name: Tartaruga Restaurant  (Unawatuna)
disc: Overlooking the sapphire blue waters of Unawatuna, Tartaruga delivers good food with an equally good view.
address: Yaddehimulla Road, Unawatuna Beach,Sri Lanka
directions: Right next to Lucky Tuna in Unawatuna

name: Fine Things (Hilton)
disc: Fine Things has been part of Hilton for years now. They are the one-stop for cakes and chocolates along with anything sweet and fine.
address: 2, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 02
directions: You will find Fine Things at the Hilton lobby

name: Chinaman
disc: Generous portions, fair price and swift delivery make Chinaman good option for office lunch.
directions: They come to you.

name: AK Ristoro (Ella)
disc: A chic little Italian joint in Ella, which doesn't really focus just on Italian. They have an extensive tapas menu.
address: No. 37, Grand View, Passara Road, Ella

name: Ella Flower Garden Resort
disc: The Flower Garden Resort has a bunch of potted plants, caged animals and birds (rather unkempt), and food along with great views.
directions: Turn right into Passara Road from the Ella Junction and it's about a kilometre or so in. You can't miss it, it's on a very prominent bend on your right.

name: PODI the Fusion Bistro
disc: Buth kade with a twist.
directions: Almost just opposite the McLaren's building on Vauxhall St.

name: Dreamcafe & Guest House
disc: Dreamcafe is an guesthouse and restaurant, which serves your regulars like coffee and whatnot, as well as some pretty dope Fish & Chips.
directions: Almost right next to Cafe Chill, walking distance from the Ella Junction.

name: Frozen (MC Foodcourt)
disc: Majestic City's new dessert stall serves up some decent ice cream, along with some other sweet treats at affordable prices.
directions: MC's right at the Bambalapitiya Junction. Go down to the basement for icecream. It's kinda opposite the Pizza Hut stall in there.

name: Coffee & Company
disc: The perfect coffee shop to bring your date, a bunch of friends or just a book.
directions: You go through Pedris Road, and turn into 30th Lane.

name: Fenghuang Lou
disc: The brand new Chinese place on Jawatta Road.
directions: It's on the main Jawatta Road strip, right after Ceilao Villas.

name: Bubblelement (Galle)
disc: A charming little bubble tea spot in the Fort.
directions: Just off Rampart and Pedlar Streets. Be careful though, it's a one way and there's no parking.

name: Ivy Lane Restaurant
disc: A tiny restaurant that serves up lunch and dinner, with a Sri Lankan and Indian menu.
directions: Head towards Colpetty on Galle Road and it's adjoining Vogue Jewellers.

name: ZY cuppies Macaroons
disc: Pretty macaroons and beautiful cupcake toppings, with a cartload of sugar.
directions: Call for directions

name: Macchiato
disc: A new coffee shop in the midst of the gargantuan Kandy Uptown.
directions: Go to Liberty Plaza and then to their new department  Kandy Uptown for Macchiato.

name: Caffe Vita
disc: A small coffee shop in the MC food court that serves up sandwiches and cake.
address: Food Court, Basement, Majestic City, Colombo 4

name: Amaage Restaurant (Point Pedro)
disc: Amaage is probably the largest restaurant in the area. They do decent kottu.
directions: If you're heading towards Point Pedro's beach, this is just before the junction where the shopping mall is, onto your left.

name: EEAT
disc: Small and underwhelming, EEAT is okay for a chinese roll and woodapple milkshake.
directions: From Thurstan Road, turn onto Flower Road and it's to your right about 100 meters in.

name: Indian Spice
disc: Indian Spice is a low-key Indian restaurant that shares the premises with the equally modest, yet somewhat dodgy China Town. The place may give out a slightly dicey feel, but the food actually isn't half bad with a pretty legit butter chicken.
directions: Sea Avenue on Galle Road is near Nations Trust Bank and The Fab. Indian Spice is on the street's Marine Drive end.

name: Tosakanth's Roast Paan
disc: As the name suggests, roast paan. Stuffed roastpaan.
directions: It's in the same building as Sugar Shack down De Fonseka Road.

name: Pugzy's Kitchen
disc: Pugzy's Kitchen is a home baker catering to our furry four-legged friends. Offering nutritious and tasty treats in pretty packaging, this is a fresh, welcome alternative to the unhealthy, dried snacks available at supermarkets.

name: Church Street Social (The Fort Bazaar)
disc: The Galle Fort's charming new boutique property
directions: It's right next to the Galle Fort Hotel.

name: Upawansa Hotel & Bakery (Borella)
address: No. 46 A, D. S. Senanayake Mwt. ,Colombo 08.
directions: In Front of the Super market.

name: Cafe Mocha (by Barista)
disc: Your regular Barista in a beautiful building.
directions: Go down High Level Road (one way) and turn into Stratford Ave. It's opposite the temple, and is just past Gandhara.

name: Fort Rotti Restaurant
disc: Sells rotti, with sliced bananas and Kandos chocolate in the middle. They also have Lassi.
address: 36 Light House Street, YMBA Building, Fort, Galle.
directions: Walk down Light House street, you can't miss the YMBA building.

name: E-Cafe
disc: E-Cafe has a nineties - early 2000s vibe going on, burgers, desserts, coffee, drinks, and bready stuff. All of them pretty good.
directions: Almost right opposite Police Park. A bit past the Vajira Road turnoff if you're heading towards Thunmulla on Havelock Road.

name: Sesto Senso
disc: Words cannot describe this experience. Only tears.
directions: It's on the cross of Pedlars Street and Lighthouse Street

name: Platinum Pier
disc: Mirage Colombo's restaurant with Chef Lloyd's signature pizza, fish and chips and intercontinental fare.
address: 61, Moors Road, Marine Drive, Wellawatta, Colombo 06
directions: It's just after Dinemor if you're heading from Bambalapitiya. Or before, if you're coming from Dehiwela.

name: Cafe Kumbuk
disc: Simple and healthy, Kumbuk does everything right with local, seasonal and organic ingredients.
directions: From Nelum Pokuna roundabout, head down Horton Place and it's to your right, right next to Flamingo House. If you're coming from Baseline Road, it's to your left.

name: Sameeha Family Restaurant
disc: Sameeha's is popular for their cheese kottu, and is one of THE places to drop into in Negombo.
directions: Go straight along the Chilaw-Colombo main road, and it's onto your right soon after driving past the Periyamulla Junction (if you're heading there from Colombo).

name: Grand Ella Motel
disc: Owned by the Ceylon Hotel Corporation, the Grand Ella has a great view, okay service, and mediocre food.
directions: From the Ella Junction, walk towards the general direction of Wellawaya. The Grand Ella is a few minutes away from the junction, onto your right.

name: Jungle Juice (Pelawatte)
directions: In front of the Pelawatte Sampath bank

name: Il Gelato (Duplication Road)
disc: Ice cream lovers rejoice! Il Gelato is back on Duplication Road. They've moved to a smaller location than their previous outlet, but the gelato is still as good.
address: R A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo
directions: IL Gelato is on Duplication Road, right opposite Queen's Cafe before the turn off to Queen's Road.

name: Amangalla
disc: One of the island's oldest and grandest colonial properties.
directions: It's in the heart of the Galle Dutch Fort, impossible to miss.

name: Tomato (Batticaloa)
disc: Considered the only proper dine-in experience in Batticaloa, their Indian food is pretty good.
directions: Head down Trinco Road from Kallady Bridge and it's to your right, just past Pan Asia Bank.

name: Batticaloa Muslim Hotel
disc: A street-side eatery that does the best beef rottis in Batticaloa. Great for breakfast with plain tea.

name: Steam Boat (Moratuwa)
address: No. 34, New Galle road, Idama, Moratuwa.
directions: Just 10m from Moratuwa cross junction in Galle driving direction.

name: Aakshathai
disc: Solid ol' Saiva Kade in Jtown.
directions: It's almost right opposite the Sri Nagavihara International Buddhist Temple.

name: Meat & Co.
disc: Meat & Co. is a home cook who grills some decent steaks at very reasonable prices
directions: The road is almost directly opposite Savoy in Wellawatte.

name: Which Way West
disc: Which Way West is a new pub that serves up okay food.
address: 1st Floor, Liberty Arcade, 282, R. A. Re Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
directions: From the Liberty junction, turn onto Duplication Road, it's at Liberty Arcade, which is just past Liberty Plaza.

name: Ikoi Tei (Dutch Hospital)
disc: An authentic and casual Japanese revamp of Work In Progress. Worth a try.
directions: It's immediately at the main entrance of the Dutch Hospital opposite the World Trade Centre. At the former WIP premises.

name: Capital City Food Court (Badulla)
disc: Capital City Food Court   .

name: Calorie Counter (Pelawatta)
disc: Calorie Counter's now in Pelawatta and with it they've introduced a bunch of new healthy dishes and desserts.
directions: Calorie Counter is just past the Pelawatta junction, opposite the Department of Examinations.

name: Poppy Hana (Urban Kitchen)
disc: Mid range conveyor belt sushi at Arpico's Urban Kitchen.
directions: On the right hand side of the Union Place entrance of Arpico Supercentre.

name: August by Mama Aida's
disc: August By Mama Aidas is the newest addition to Colombos Middle Eastern restaurant repertoire. With authentic dishes, exceptional service and a chic, relaxing setting, August looks like its here to stay.
directions: August is at the same premises as Shirohana Petal Guru on Dudley Senanayake Mawatha, just passed the Lamborghini showroom on the opposite side of the road.

name: Black Cat Cafe
disc: The Black Cat Cafe serves up amazing sandwiches, coffee, and fresh fruit juices. They're also a B+B.
directions: It's on Wijerama Mawatha just between Ward Place and Rosmead Place. If you're heading in from Ward Place, it's onto your left.

name: Beard Papa's (Urban Kitchen)
disc: Beard Papa's is an international franchise which specializes in cream puffs. The first outlet opened in Japan in 1999.
directions: It's situated in the Arpico Supercentre premises, and shares space with Urban Kitchen. Turn right soon after you enter UK.

name: Licensed to Grill
disc: Licensed to Grill is a food stall which whips up wraps, burgers, and a couple of grilled items for super reasonable prices.
address: George E de Silva Park, Dalada Veediya, Kandy
directions: It's a stall at Torrington Park, right between the Kandy Clock Tower and the Lake. If you're walking towards the clock tower, it's soon as you pass the White House restaurant, onto your left.

name: Blue Field Tea Centre
disc: You can buy tea powder or tea leaves here, as well as sit down and have a cuppa. They've also got a small selection of pastries at times.
directions: It's right at the end of Haig Road, more towards Marine Drive.

name: Natural Coffee
disc: Natural Coffee is one of Kandy's most popular coffee shops. They also have macha tea/ milk.
directions: It's in the same area as the entrance to the Dalada Maligawa. You can't miss it if you walk towards Temple Street with your back to the lake.

name: Bencita On Wheels
disc: Serving up waffles out of a food truck, Bencita On Wheels is a convenient take-away option if you travel through Dutugemunu Street.
directions: It's on Dutugemunu Street. If you're coming in from Pamankada it's to your left, if you're approaching from Kohuwala junction, it's to your right.

name: The Icebair Restaurant
disc: Icebair is a small, underrated, Swiss-owned outlet in Negombo with a great, rustic atmosphere.
directions: If you're heading north along Lewis Place, it's about a five minute walk before the Golden Star Beach Hotel. It's a few metres past the hotel if you're heading towards Colombo.

name: KGN Burgers on Wheels
disc: KGN Burgers on Wheels is a food truck on Hill Street that serves up some surprisingly tasty burgers. It's only a two man operation, but it's very efficient, clean and they seem to be a hit with the folks.
directions: We found KGN just past Dharmarama Rd on Hill Street.

name: The Noodle Monkey
disc: The Noodle Monkey is a new cafe on Haig Road by Don Stanley's group. While their food has its merits, they've tried to do too much with the menu and the entire operation lacks direction.
directions: Heading from Kollupitiya, go south on Marine Drive. You'll pass the Bamba rail station and Majestic City (Station Road). It's the fourth street after that.

name: The Red Pineapple by Torana
disc: Nestled among the Torana shops on Galle Road, this little eatery serves up a good fried rice, a hefty chow mein, and quite a range of juices.
directions: It's opposite Colombo Jewellery Stores on Galle Road.

name: Marrybrown
disc: Right on Marine Drive, Marrybrown is a cheaper option for fried chicken and burgers. They're generous with their mayo, and their chicken is all about the crispy skin.
directions: On Marine Drive, heading towards Colombo, pass the Kirulapone Canal and it's to your right.

name: Shri Vani Vilas
disc: This saivar kade does some killer dishes and has earned street cred for being the best in Colombo.
directions: Drive straight along Armour Street and take a left at Messenger Street. It's almost as soon as you turn in.

name: 88 Restaurant (Dehiwela)
disc: The longstanding 88 Chinese Restaurant has opened up a branch in Dehiwela, serving most items except for all pork dishes.
directions: It's on the seaside, just after you pass Cargills.

name: Dwaraka
disc: Dwaraka is a new pure vegetarian Indian restaurant in Bambalapitiya. Although we ran into a few hiccups, we still walked away pleased with our meal.
directions: Dwaraka is basically on Marine Drive, right at the turn off to Jaya Road.

name: Tea Breeze  (Racecourse)
disc: Tea Breeze is Mackwood's tea bar. They have decent teas, and good waffles.
address: GS 4, Ground Floor, Race Course Grand Stand, Reid Avenue, Colombo 07
directions: It's in the same building as the Amante Boutique. Right next to it, in fact.

name: Alumka Caterers (Thalawathugoda)
directions: It's between the P & S and Sampath Bank, just before Thalawathugoda junction when travelling from Pelawatte

name: Kate Ryori
disc: Kate Ryori is a homecook in Colombo that serves up tasty Japanese cuisine at affordable prices with some pretty filling portions to boot. It's a tiny operation, but she's pretty much the only Japanese homecook we know of and it's a great change-up from the usual Japanese restaurants.
directions: She's a home cook so directions will be given once orders are placed.

name: Flamingo House
disc: The aptly-named Flamingo House is the newestand probably funkiest addition to Colombos restaurant repertoire. The food is inconsistent but interesting, but the excellent cocktails and crazy interior win brownie points.
directions: Heading up Horton Place, it's past the Coffee Bean and on your right just before Wijerama Mawatha, right behind Gerard Mendis Chocolatier.

name: Boutique Cafe
disc: They have a variety of dishes including Sri Lankan, Western, Arab, and Chinese.
directions: If you walk into Church Street from Rampart Street, it's a few metres in onto your right.

name: Serendipity Arts Cafe
disc: This is a somewhat eccentric cafe with great music, interesting decor, and somewhat mediocre food.
directions: If you're walking down Hospital Street, keeping the Dutch Hospital premises onto your right, go straight ahead and take the first turn right, and then the first turn left.

name: The Silver Spoon
disc: The Silver Spoon is a quality buth kade in Ratmalana that serves wholesome food at decent prices. (Steer clear of the meat, though)
directions: The Silver Spoon is in Ratmalana on Galle Road, before the Maliban Junction, next to Five Star Bakery.

name: No.1 Dewmini Roti Shop (Mirissa)
disc: Mirissa seems to love its roti, and no one does it better than No.1 Dewmini Roti Shop. It's a small, family-run restaurant that offers an impressive variety of dishes, along with some of the best savoury and sweet rotis we've had.
directions: Turn into Udupila Rd from Matara Rd. Travel in about 200m and take the first lane to your right (you'll see a small sign there). Take the second right on that lane and you'll find the roti shop.

name: In Doo Se Restaurant
disc: In Doo Se is an Indian Restaurant situated in Thalawathugoda. It's a wonderful place to enjoy a pure Indian meal with a good service.
directions: Turn left from the Borella - Kottawa Road to Nugegoda Road from Thalawathugoda Junction & keep going for about 150m. In Doo Se is in front of the Keells Super Market.

name: The Sandwich Factory (Colombo 3)
disc: Sandwich Factory does a filling take  on western diner favorites.
directions: It's the road adjacent to the WSO2 building on Duplication Road.

name: Rasa Bojun
disc: This is a new buth kade off Havelock Road, near Thumulla. It's basically average.
directions: From Thumulla Junction, head down Havelock Road. It's the second lane on your right, you can park there usually.

name: BakesByBella
disc: Bakes by Bella has come a long way, from starting off as a little home baker to now having a full-blown delicatessen at Alfred House Avenue. They serve up a fantastic brunch menu in addition to a bunch of new treats up for grabs.
directions: It's a bit of a maze, but head on into Alfred House Avenue and they're on the left side of the main lane.

name: Nelum Kole
disc: Nelum Kole is a rice-and-curry kade in Boralesgamuwa that provides a convenient and cost-effective lunch spread.
directions: It's near the Boralesgamuwa Lake. You can take High Level Road to Maharagama and loop back around, or take the 120 bus road and turn onto the Maharagama Road. Go till you get to the Lake and turn down a little lane near the end. Look at the map.

name: Mirissa Beach Wadiya
disc: So Mirissa's got their own Beach Wadiya (though not associated with Colombo's Wadiya). They offer a decent variety of seafood with an emphasis on the day's catch. The execution, however, was inconsistent.
directions: From the Udupila junction, head straight down to the beach. It's along the beach stretch, next to the Mirissa Eye restaurant.

name: Rasa Sayang Indian Food
disc: Rasa Sayang is a new Indian take-out restaurant on Hill St, run by the same management as The Malay Restaurant.
directions: Rasa Sayang is on Hill Street,  about 500m up from the Dehiwala Junction, just before Cafe Asiana.

name: Montage
disc: Montage would have ranked as ok chinese seafood until I uncovered something inside the dish.
directions: Trek it down Siripala Road, right opposite Mount Grill. You can't miss it right at the bottom.

name: Reef House Cafe
disc: Reef House Cafe is a small shack of a restaurant on Mount Beach. It's got an undeniably dodgy feel to it, but the food isn't terrible and they do serve booze. That plus the fact that they're open well into the night makes this a popular spot for a meetup.
directions: The easiest way to get to Reef House Cafe is to turn into Siripala Rd from Galle Rd, and come all the way down to the beach.  Reef House Cafe is to the right as you enter the beach.

name: Tiffin Hut (Grand Oriental Hotel)
disc: Though reliable, the tiffin hut doesn't have the tastiest food in Fort.
directions: Passing the Old Dutch Hospital head up York Street. GOH is at the end.

name: Cake Whisperer
disc: Cake Whisperer is yet another good Colombo home-baker. They do simple, sweet cupcakes mostly - some of the best butter-cream frosting ones we've had.

name: Il Ponte (Hilton)
disc: Il Ponte at Hilton is one of the older Italian restaurants in Colombo. It may not be as popular as it was back in the day, but their Italian fare is pretty solid all-round.
address: 2, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 01
directions: Come along Galle Road past the Galle Face Green, turn right at the Kingsbury roundabout and make your way to the Hilton. Il Ponte is located by the poolside on the ground floor.

name: Wonderbar
disc: Wonderbar is a sweet-toothed vegan's dream come true. They offer you gluten, sugar, and dairy-free desserts and smoothies,
directions: Opposite the Colombo Racecourse, enter Lakpahana and you'll find the Good Market outlet. Wonderbar products are available there.

name: The Gourmet Station (The Kingsbury)
disc: The Cake is a bakery-cum-mini confectionery outlet located at The Kingsbury. It offers baked goodies and chocolates.
directions: The Kingsbury is right at the end of Galle Face before you turn towards Pettah. Once you enter the lobby, walk right down to the end onto your right, and you'd come to The Cake.

name: Pizza Hut (Attidiya)
disc: We all like the occasional slice of unorthodox pizza. But is Pizza Hut really worth the buck you're paying for it? Somewhat.
directions: Head down Attidiya Road from Bakery Junction. It's about a kilometre away.

name: Mr. Kottu Restaurant
disc: Have you tried Hopper Kottu? Mr. Kottu is the place to go.
address: No. 243, Thalawathugoda Road, Wijitha Pura, Pitakotte
directions: If you are coming on Atulkotte to Pitakotte road, you have to come  Pitakotte junction first. Then turn left &  keep going about 1km towards Thalawathugoda town.

name: CocoCeylon
disc: CocoCeylon is a mysterious business that we spotted only on Instagram. They offer overpriced smoothies and chia puddings.

name: Shandong Chinese Restaurant
disc: Shandong is a new Chinese restaurant in Rajagiriya, spearheaded by a few Industry veterans. They're one of the better choices when it comes to Sri Lankan Chinese delivery, though certain areas have plenty of room for improvement.

name: Cinnamon Lakeside Sushi Bar
disc: The sushi bar at the Cinnamon Lakeside lobby is actually a great place for an authentic Japanese meal for very affordable prices.
address: 115, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
directions: It's between Lake House and the Air Force Headquarters.

name: The Kandos Shop
disc: The Kandos Shop is a super cheap, one-stop-for-all candy shop, featuring one of Sri Lanka's oldest chocolate brands. It's an ideal stop for kids and gift shopping.
directions: It's just a minute from Dinemore and Olive Garden, next to the Vijitha Yapa bookstore.

name: Flavors (Galadari)
disc: Flavors is Galadari Hotel's Indian restaurant. Their food is actually pretty decent, but the ambience, or rather the lack of it makes you want to wrap up your meal as fast as possible.
directions: Flavors is located at the back of the main lobby area on the ground floor of Galadari Hotel.

name: Red Orchids
disc: Red Orchids is like the new Flower Drum, with the same staff and waiters, and again they do tasty classic Sri Lankanized Chinese food at affordable rates.
directions: Castle Lane is near the Bamba flats, almost opposite Shakthi Institute. Head down here to the Marine Drive end and you'll see it on your left.

name: Sawadee (Mount Breeze Hotel)
disc: The Sawadee , a part of Mount Breeze Hotel offers reliable food and service at reasonable prices.
address: 22/5A, Mount Breeze Hotel, Off De Saram Road, Mount Lavinia, Colombo
directions: You can head to the bottom of  Off De Saram Road (The name of the road is actually Off De Saram) , or settle to walk along to the beach. The beachfront restaurant is passed La Voile Blanche and before (RIP) Lavinia Breeze.

name: Thalis
disc: Serving both north and south Indian thalis in addition to a la carte dishes, this all-vegetarian eatery is authentic and affordable  two adjectives we love a little more than others.
directions: On Park Road, go straight past Jack Tree and Off the Hook, towards Havelock Town. The restaurant will be on your right.

name: Shahla's Baked Bliss
disc: Shahla's Baked Bliss is a home baker who specializes in jars full of toothsome goodies. It's not too pricey and her jars and brownies are top notch.

name: Family Baker
disc: Family Baker is arguably the best mainstream bakery in Mount Lavinia. They've got a great selection of both savories and sweets, which have been consistently tasty time and time again.
directions: From Colombo, head down the Galle Road till you get to Mount Lavinia (passing No Limit, the cemetery). Family Baker is at Family Super, which is right opposite the Lion Pub.

name: The Fresh Milk Shop (Kiri Kade)
disc: Kiri Kade, which humbly began as a milk delivery service is one of the most well established milk delivery services we know of. They still deliver and their milk is still fresh and flavoursome.
directions: Head down Duplication Road and pass the St. Peter's Sports Complex. Turn left when you cross the canal. The shop should be fifty metres down.

name: Kami Maki (Delivery)
disc: Kami Maki is one of two Japanese delivery spots in Colombo. The sushi may not be the best in town, but its not too bad and the delivery is fast and reliable.

name: Hotel de Majestic
disc: Hotel de Majestic is one of the oldest kottu-and-biriyani stops on the Bamba Galle Road stretch. It's a popular and easily accessible stopover for biriyani and a quick cold drink.
directions: It's right opposite Majestic City, amidst the kades next to MD Gunasena Bookshop.

name: The Sushi Bar (Samurai)
disc: This Japanese stopover is a wonderful addition to Negombo's popular stretch of restaurants. The food and service are great and they've got a sushi conveyor belt in the evenings.
directions: It's right next to Cafe J and  the Jetwing Blue hotel, a few minutes from the Rodeo pub.

name: The Tangerine (Calamansi Cove)
disc: The Tangerine is a gem of restaurant hidden away in Balapitiya at Calamansi Cove by Jetwing. As far hotel restaurants go, this is one of the best we've tried in recent times. Delicious food, beautiful presentation and good service.
address: Wijerama Temple Rd, Balapitiya, Sri Lanka
directions: The Tangerine is at Calamansi Cove, which is at the end of Wijeramam Temple Rd, less than a 1 km from the Balapitiya bus dept and the Jumma Musjid.

name: The Chariot (Bambalapitiya)
disc: The Chariot, most popular for their branch in Dehiwala, is an accessible and affordable stop for baked goods and rice and curry.
directions: It's a minute from the Bambalapitiya Flats, opposite Shakthi Institute.

name: Chinatry
disc: Chinatry is an Sichuan Chinese restaurants.  The punchy, spicy flavors are authentic but still good for the Sri Lankan palate.
directions: Chinatry is at the corner of Flower Road and Green Path. Coming down Green Path, turn right.

name: Red Snapper
disc: Red Snapper is a seafood restaurant at the Dutch Hospital that does a range of crab and lobster preparations. It's a formal dining place that plays a lot of '90s saxophone music and serves OK food.
directions: It's just around the back of the Dutch Hospital, next to the Shamrock bar and lounge and near the green bricked Economic Museum.

name: Olive Garden Restaurant
disc: Olive Garden is another one of Colombo's many Chinese restaurants. The food is good and affordable, and they've got private rooms if you want to take a big crowd with you.
directions: It's right at the cross between 5th Lane and Thurstan Road, before the Flower Drum takeaway joint.

name: Terro's Pies & Roasts
disc: Terro's Pies and Roasts is a home cook in Dehiwala that bakes some tasty pies and serves up some hearty roast meats. As far as home cooks go, we'd say she's a great pick for savory dishes.

name: Anilana Pasikuda (Restaurant)
disc: Anilana is one of Pasikuda's big beachside hotels. They've got killer ambience late in the evening, and they do a very good Jaffna crab curry.

name: Dhawalagiri Hotel
disc: The Dhawalagiri is a typical saivar kadey, where you can drop in to get a quick, oily bite. It's in central Maradana, you can't miss it.
address: 433, P de S Kularatne Mawatha, Colombo 10
directions: It's  just past the Maradana Police Station

name: Amaya Beach Pasikuda
disc: Amaya is one of the big hotels on Pasikuda bay. It's huge, and though looks-wise is a little old school, is still incredibly efficient and ideal for some holiday pampering.

name: Coffee Bar (Grand Hotel, NE)
disc: The Coffee Bar by the Grand Hotel is probably the best coffee shop in Nuwara Eliya. They've got a chic little space and an accessible location to go along with some good food and great coffee.
directions: Turn into Grand Hotel Rd from the Victoria Park roundabout and make your way up about 100m. The Coffee Bar is next to the Grand Indian, just past Hotel Glendower.

name: Cafe Beverly
disc: Cafe Beverly is a comfortable, affordable dining space in the premises of the Beverly Street shopping complex in Rajagiriya.
directions: If you're heading towards Rajagiriya from Battaramulla, it's just past KFC and before Keells Super.

name: Ammi's Meaty Delights
disc: Ammi's Meaty Delights is a home cook that delivers Sri Lankan style meat dishes. We tried their beef, chicken and pork dishes and they all turned out be very satisfying.

name: Malay Street Buth Kade
disc: This basic buth kade serves a good rice and curry and sorta specializes in baabath (tripe - ie cow stomach).
directions: From the Slave Island junction (where Burgers King is) head down Malay Street towards Fort. This place has no sign or name. It's on your right, at corner of Mews Street (the third road). You can sometimes park down Mews.

name: Smokey's (The Brownie Bar)
disc: Smokey's is a home baker that specializes in delicious brownies at easy prices - and they happen to be completely vegan too.

name: Lantheruma (The Lantern)
disc: Latheruma does a really tasty and cheap rice and curry lunch.
address: De Fonseka Road, near Vajira Junction
directions: This is near Visakha College, so no chance of parking nearby.  If you're coming from Duplication Rd, you can go up Vajira and turn onto De Fonseka. You can also get on De Fonseka from Dickman's Rd.

name: Flag And Whistle
disc: If you make it to the north side, Flag And Whistle is a well-appointed space with a view of the port. They do hearty but expensive German fare.
address: 5th Floor, Setmil Maritime Centre, 256, Srimath Ramanathan Mawatha, Colombo 15
directions: Pass through Port and head towards Pettah. Instead of taking Main Street, take the road hugging the coastline past St. Anthony's Church into Kotahena. It's about two block further, as the road curves. Look for the Setmil sign.

name: Seafood Cove (Mt. Lavinia Hotel)
disc: Seafood Cove is Mt. Lavinia Hotel's seafood restaurant. It has a great location on their private beach front, fast service and reasonably priced, fresh seafood.
address: No 100, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, turn to Hotel Road (the road that leads down from ODEL), Mount Lavinia hotel is at the very end. Pretty hard to miss.

name: Miss Whisk
disc: Miss Whisk is another Colombo home baker,  and she does interesting themed cupcakes and some delicious strawberry tarts.
directions: This is the home-baker's house so we can't post the exact address - call for directions.

name: Ashik
disc: Ashik was once a popular choice amongst the YAMU staff for their rice and curry. Our latest visit left a negative impact on us though, and here's why.
directions: Ashik is on Duplication Rd, just past the Laugfs office, opposite Cafe Orange Peel

name: The Ocean (The Kingsbury)
disc: The Ocean is the Kingsbury's seafood restaurant. The food is fresh off the ice onto the pan - it's good, and they also do a decent, affordable sashimi.
directions: The Kingsbury is right at the end of Galle Face before you turn towards Pettah. Once you walk into the lobby, walk straight in past the cafe and the Harbour Court and you'll find the Ocean at the end, on your left.

name: The Gardenia Coffee Shop (Ramada)
disc: The Gardenia is Hotel Ramada's main restaurant, and they do a wide range of cuisines, from Italian to Jaffna, that are good value for money.
address: Ground Floor, No. 30, Sri Mohamed Macan Marker Mawatha, Colombo 3
directions: Take the right turn at the Galle Face roundabout (right after Inn On The Green), and Ramada will be on your right. Walk straight in to the end of the lobby to reach the restaurant.

name: Flower Gate
disc: Flower Gate is a new and very welcome addition to the Sri Lankan Chinese food scene. They may be relatively unknown, but theirs was some of the best Chinese we've had in a while.
address: 2, Victoria Place, Elivitiala Mawatha (Baseline Rd), Colombo 8

name: EAT (OZO Colombo)
disc: Aside from their buffet, OZO actually has a pretty good a-la carte menu with an interesting range of dishes from burgers to steak.
directions: You'll find Clifford Place next to Chariot on Galle Road - turn into it and you'll find OZO at the very end on your right on Marine Drive.

name: Diwan Restaurant
disc: Diwan is a new multi-cuisine restaurant on Sri Saranankara Road. It's mostly known for it's Indian cuisine, which is what we tried, but they also offer Chinese and Italian.
directions: Diwan is on Sri Saranankara Rd, just a bit past the Sumanadisi Bakers outlet.

name: Zephyr Restaurant & Bar
disc: Zephyr is a very exciting new restaurant and bar on the Mirissa beach stretch. The food is good, and they've got a great ambience that sticks out from the rest.
directions: It's on the stretch that's directly parallel to Udupila Road/ Udupila junction, near Mirissa Beach Wadiya guest house and Ocean Moon guest house.

name: The Vu
disc: The Vu is the rooftop restaurant at The Beach in Negombo. It may be a new venture, but the food is good, the service is excellent and as you'd expect, the view is spectacular.
directions: The Vu is located on the rooftop of The Beach (hotel). it's on Lewis Place (Beach Road),  past Camelot Beach, Paradise Beach, just after Hotel Silver Sands. It's on a lane right next to a church.

name: Eat Right
disc: EatRight.lk is a delivery site with an exclusively healthy menu, from healthy wraps to healthy kottu. It's also got a lot of info on it to help you stay fit.

name: Little Star
disc: Little Star is a not-so-little bakery in Mount Lavinia with a reputation for their Sri Lankan sweets
directions: Little Star is on Galle Rd, right next to the Cargills Food City in Mount Lavinia

name: Tea Triumph
disc: Tea Triumph is a very cosy tea lounge down Marine Drive - they've existed since 1940, and have a lovely range of quality, locally-brewn tea.
directions: When you're heading down Marine Drive towards Kollupitiya - it's right after Marina Casino and before Carlwil Place.

name: Dilmi Roti Shop (Beach Corner)
disc: Dilmi Roti Shop is one of the many roti shops in Mirissa. They serve chocolate rotis, pineapple rotis, cheese rotis and so on, and their milkshakes are awesome.
directions: It's near the Udupila junction and the Ocean Moon guest house, next to a wall sprayed with blue graffiti.

name: Golden Dragon (Taj)
disc: Golden Dragon is the completely redone Taj take on Chinese cuisine. It has a stellar ambience and good food.
address: Taj Samudra, 25 Galle Face Center Rd, Colombo 3
directions: The Taj is across from Galle Face Green. When you enter the Taj, turn left and go out the doors. It's right there, just to your left.

name: Lifestyle Gym Snack Bar
disc: The snack bar at the Lifestyle Gym offers some very healthy drinks and wraps - also, yummy cookies.
directions: The Sri Lanka Tennis Association is near the Public Library and National Museum, at the top of Sir Marcus Fernando Mawatha if you're coming from Kollupitiya. Walk into the premises and down the corridor ahead, Lifestyle gym will be the first door on your right.

name: Taste Of Asia
disc: Taste of Asia is a very affordable favourite on Galle Road for hoppers and Jaffna food.
directions: It's near the Wellawatte bridge and Savoy, right opposite St Peter's College.

name: Schakasz
disc: Schakasz is a little cafe in Kirulapone exclusively for desserts. They've got everything from creme brulee to chocolate ganache cake, in large portions.
directions: It's right next to the Stratford Avenue Barista, before Cafe Che - look for light teal canopies.

name: Hash Deli
disc: Hash Deli is an awesome homebaker of cakes that has shot to popularity through Good Market. They make a killer cheesecake.
address: Good Market (Diyatha Uyana), Polduwa Road, Ethul Kotte, Battaramulla
directions: Head down the Parliament Road (continuing along Horton Place is a good place to start) through Rajagiriya and into Battaramulla. Don't turn towards Parliament, keep going to your left and turn into Water's Edge. You'll see the Good Market, but only on Thursdays.

name: Kinjou
disc: Kinjou is one of the oldest Chinese restaurants in Colombo. Their stuff is as Sri Lankanized as it gets, but it's just okay at best.
directions: Kinjou is on Amarasekara Mw, just off Havelock Road opposite the Henry Pedris Childrens Park.

name: Garton's Ark
disc: Garton's Ark is a floating (boat) restaurant in the Nugegoda Wetlands Park.
address: Urban Wetland Park, 100 Nawala Rd, Nugegoda
directions: The Wetland Park is off the Nawala Rd, on the Nugegoda side. If you're coming thru Nawala, it's past the Open University and all the tile shops. If you're coming from Nugegoda, it's about 200m past the Supermarket Junction.

name: Curry Leaves
disc: Curry  Leaves is one of Colombo's oldest Indian restaurants, but remains mostly under the radar. Their strength lies in their biryani, but the rest of the dishes were pretty ordinary.
directions: Curry Leaves is located midway through W.A Silva Mawatha, just past  Almaas (or before if you enter from Havelock Rd)

name: The Fab Cafe
disc: The Fab Cafe, the coffee lounge by The Fab is relatively unknown cafe down Castle street. They've got a chic space and some great Hot chocolate.
directions: Vivace is  on the first floor of The Fab in Borella, which is on Castle Street past  the Castle maternity Hospital, right at the turn off to Sarasavi Lane.

name: The Bakery at the Edge (Waters Edge)
disc: Colombo's only drive-through bakery. They've got good ice cream and amazing chocolate fudge cake.
directions: Turn into Polduwa Road around Diyatha Uyana, and head left into the Waters Edge drive way. The Bakery drive-through is just a little ways in, on your right.

name: My Sister's Kitchen
disc: Tasty home-cooked Jaffna style dishes - they do orders in bulk, so ideal for lunch or dinner parties.

name: Quick Thai (Colombo 7)
disc: Quick Thai serves up pretty good, filling Thai dishes at affordable prices.
directions: It's down Maitland Place past Perera & Sons and just opposite the Colombo Cricket Club Ground.

name: Candy Cakes
disc: This home baker does cake jars, and jars full of all kinds of candy.

name: Zen (Zylan Boutique Hotel)
disc: Zen is Zylan boutique hotel's hidden gem of a Japanese restaurant. They made a great first impression on our visit, and we love their new bento boxes.
directions: Go straight on Kynsey Road past Gonuts with Donuts and Cioconut Lounge. ZEN is at the Zylan Luxury Villa, just as you turn into Rosmead Place.

name: Candle Light Hut
disc: Candle Light Hut is a pretty popular, affordable place for Pakistani biriyani, paratha and meat curries.
directions: It's not very far from Galle Road - a few minutes away from the Budhdhagosha School and Royal Sweet Mart.

name: Sri Siam
disc: Sri Siam on W.A. Silva Mawatha is yet another new Thai restaurant. We had high hopes since it's run by Thai management, but the food just wasn't up to par.
directions: Sri Siam shares the premises with Curry Leaves which is located midway through W.A Silva Mawatha, just past Almaas (or before it, if you enter from Havelock Rd)

name: Lil' Orbits (Majestic City)
disc: Lil' Orbits is an awesome place to go to for your sugar cravings. The prices are alright and the chocolate sauce is gold.
directions: Majestic City is just before the Bambalapitiya junction, opposite Lauries Road. Enter it and go down to the basement, Lil Orbits is on the far left corner of the food court.

name: Sugar Rush
disc: Sugar Rush is another home-baker who makes some very nice fudgey brownies, and a great creamy lemon cake.
directions: Heading down Park Road from Havelock Road, you have to pass Cargills and Jack Tree - and just after Shalika Grounds, it's the black gate on your left.

name: Mirissa Eye Beach Restaurant
disc: This is one of the better beach-side Mirissa restaurants if you want seafood. They also do a super banana & chocolate milkshake.
directions: It's near the Udupila junction, and easy to find when you get to the Mirissa beach stretch - it's near Ocean Moon guest house and Mirissa Beach Wadiya guest house.

name: Malayan Cafe (Jaffna)
disc: If you're looking for a clean, charming and authentic meal in Jaffna, we highly recommend the vegetarian Malayalan Cafe.
directions: The main road in Jaffna is Hospital Road. Power House Rd runs parallel to that. If you're heading up Hospital Rd, turn right after the bust stand. Then you'll be on Power House and it's there.

name: Peace Villa Restaurant
disc: Peace Villa is a little restaurant down Lewis Place, Negombo. The food was actually kind of underwhelming, but they serve a great glass of 'All Milkshake'.
directions: Head down Lewis Place where the hotels are - it's opposite Angel Inn, near Peacock Pub

name: The Travelling Food Tuk
disc: The Travelling Food Tuk is a lunch-delivery place - the food is home-made, gourmet even, and the prices not too bad.
directions: Delivery is free in Kotte, Rajagiriya, Borella and Colombo 7, and otherwise the charges are for about Rs. 100-150. No delivery to Nugegoda, Wellawatte or beyond Dematagoda

name: Tom Yum
disc: Tom Yum specializes in Thai street food. We think it's some of the best Thai around.
directions: Coming down Galle Rd past 7 Stories, Tom Yum is right Opposite St.Peter's College.

name: Mithuro Cafe
disc: Mithuro Cafe does good rice and curry for cheap, and we especially love their 'chicken pieces' rotti.
address: 9, R. A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 04
directions: It's right opposite Levi's and near Laugfs on Duplication Road.

name: Pizza Hut
disc: Pizza Hut's stuff isn't half bad, and their desserts are actually quite great, but the portions don't justify the prices.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, Pizza Hut is a bit past the St.Mary's Church, about 300m before the Dehiwala Junction.

name: A Minute By Tuk (Galle Dutch Hospital)
disc: A Minute By Tuk is a little eatery in the Galle Dutch Hospital. The ambience is cool since it's up on a deck, but the food is pricey and just okay.
address: Old Hospital Building, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: At the first roundabout inside the fort, go left, pass the Dutch Church and turn left on Queens St. Keep going till that road curves past the Magistrate's Square and turns into Hospital Street. Park there and walk forward to the Old Dutch Hospital. This is on the first floor, at the front of the courtyard.

name: The Original Rocket Burger
disc: Rocket Burger is the Galle Fort's only burger specialist.  The patties are well ground and they're usually very generous with stuffing -  you're going to spend Rs. 900 minimum for a burger here though.
directions: Just head down Pedlars Street towards Hospital Street. It's about a block away from The Heritage Cafe, next to the Three By TPV store.

name: Dairy King
disc: Dairy King is a good place to stop by for ice cream - and fat chocolatey brownies - if you're in Galle Fort.
directions: Church Street is very near the Mosque on Rampart street, just walk into the street from the rampart side and you'll see pink and blue walls on your right.

name: Yumi Cake
disc: Yumi Cake is a cute little restaurant that serves awesome desserts - chocolate fudge lovers, this is your haven.
directions: Yumi is at the end of Flower Road, on the same building as Choco Luv. It's near House of Wines.

name: Cafe Hula Hula (Galle)
disc: Cafe Hula Hula near the ramparts of Galle Fort serves good kottu, tasty seafood, and - yay! - we found great eclairs here.
directions: It's just where Rampart Street meets Pedlar Street, opposite the rampart.

name: Good Market Shop (Lakpahana Grounds)
disc: Good Market isn't just once a week anymore. Besides at Diyatha Uyana (Thursdays) and Racecourse (Saturdays), you can now get Good Market's fresh, organic food straight from local vendors, on Lakpahana premises.
directions: The shop is on your immediate left inside Lakpahana grounds - Lakpahana is just opposite the Racecourse building, which is between the CCC Ground and the University of Colombo.

name: Peking Palace
disc: Peking Palace in Nawala serves up some decent Sri Lankanized Chinese cuisine at an accessible location.
directions: Peking Palace is past the Nawala Junction and Arpico Home Concepts, right next to the Cargills Food City

name: Deen's Kitchen
disc: Rather greasy and heavy food.
directions: It's just above Havelock Road on Isipathana Mw.

name: Arthur's Pizza
disc: Arthur's pizza is now a pub, too. They do their own take on localised pizza.
directions: Coming down Galle Rd, past the Mt.Lavinia Cemetery, Arthur's Pizza is right next to the Lion Pub (oppsite Family Super).

name: Huasui Chinese Restaurant
disc: Huasui is yet another Chinese restaurant to join the many we've got in Colombo. The ambience is pretty pleasant and the food is nothing amazing compared to the flavour and portions in other Chinese restaurants, but it is good.
directions: Turn right at the Kollupitiya junction, and it's on your left just before the yellow Kollupitiya Super Market building.

name: Off The Hook
disc: Off The Hook is a fresh seafood restaurant and bar  located on Park Road run by the same management as The Bavarian German Restaurant.
directions: Off The Hook is on Park Road at the top of Esther Place, which you've likely never heard of. If you're coming up from Havelock Road it's after Fife Road and before the Cargills. If you're coming from Baseline Road, it's after the Cargills and Jack Tree.

name: Tea Avenue
disc: Tea Avenue is a very cosy stop on Barnes Place to have a good cup of flavoured tea and some bready goods. The prices are good and the ambience is suited for all kinds of meetups.
directions: Turn into Barnes Place from C.W.W.Kannangara Mw, go past Museus College. Tea Avenue is right at the Wijerama Mw junction.

name: Foodie-Colombo (Home Baker)
disc: Foodie-Colombo is a home baker that's good at creamy chocolate frosting cupcakes, and cake popsicles.

name: Cremalato
disc: Cremalato is a local gelato manufacturer that actually delivers frozen confections.  We tried a bunch of their new flavours and we think they're pretty awesome.
directions: The pick-up location for Cremalato is at A & M Cupcakes on Galle Road, past the Bambalapitiya Junction, opposite Barefoot.

name: Bilal Hotel
disc: Bilal Hotel is a little kade on Bamba's Galle Road that serves kottu, fried rice, biriyani and the likes. The prices are low and the kottu is super cheesey.
directions: This is right opposite Majestic City on Galle Road, just after MD Gunasena, and before Hotel de Majestic.

name: Hammock Cafe & Pub (Galle Dutch Hospital)
disc: The Hammock Cafe in the Galle Dutch Hospital has a great location and cool seating, but the food is pretty expensive and mediocre.
address: Old Dutch Hospital, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: At the first roundabout inside the fort, turn left, pass the Dutch Church and turn left on Queens St. Keep going till that road curves past the Magistrate's Square and turns into Hospital Street. Park there and walk forward to the Old Dutch Hospital.

name: Choco Luv Pizza Delivery
disc: So among all the delivery joints thankfully cropping up in Colombo for the benefit of those of us who want to eat lazily at home, Choco Luv has made itself known as an unlikely contender in the realm of pizza delivery.
directions: It's delivery from their outlet on Gregory's Road.

name: Indo Ceylon Cafe
disc: Their coconut chutney lifts to high heavens an otherwise mediocre array of South Indian staples.
directions: Right opposite Carnival ice cream and National Savings Bank, just before the Kollupitiya junction.

name: Mamas Galle Fort Guest House
disc: Mamas Guest House is a decent place to stop by for rice and curry and other meals in the Galle Fort. It's cosy and you can meet Mama herself.
address: 67, Small Cross Street, off Church Street, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: Get close to the rampart side of the fort - Mamas Guest House is in the first by-lane to your right if you enter Church Street from the ramparts.

name: Chinese Juchunyuan
disc: Chinese Juchunyuan in Colpetty is one of the few places in town to try out Chinese hotpot. The catch, however, is that if you don't add the right ingredients to the hotpot you'll basically end up drinking broth. On the flipside, it can also be excellent should you make it right.
address: 450/B, Charles Drive, off Duplication Road, Colombo 3
directions: You go down Duplication Road past Mahanama and the Beverley Street store and in front of a big white Jewellery store, you'll find the restaurant in Charles Drive on your right.

name: Garden Cafe (T-sips)
disc: Garden Cafe is an awesome little tea lounge hiding behind a Noritake store in Duplication Road. They serve neat tall glasses of chilled tea, not to mention smoothies and brownies, and the prices are low.
address: 399, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 3
directions: It's where Bagatalle Road and Duplication Road cross, right opposite Envoy Mission, before British Council.

name: Kebabish
disc: Kebabish is a new street side restaurant in Dehiwala that offers South Asian and Mediterranean cuisine. They maybe a small place but their big on taste.
directions: On Galle Road past Chariot, right at the entrance to Hilda Lane (opposite Holy Family Convent Dehiwala).

name: Navayuga
disc: Navayuga is a pretty nice Indian restauran. Set inside what seems to have once been a charming house, it's cosy, and their menu is pretty wide.
directions: Abdul Caffoor Mawatha is just past HNB and Baskin Robbins on Galle Road, the restaurant is a 5-minute walk in.

name: Rasa Malaysia
disc: Rasa Malaysia is a relatively new restaurant down the Mount Lavinia beach stretch, alongside common beach food names like Steam Boat and Loon Tao. The ambience by the beach is obviously awesome, and the food is alright - but we fell in love with their hot butter cuttlefish.
address: Mount Lavinia beach, Off De Saram Road, Mount Lavinia
directions: From Galle Road, go down the road opposite Family Super Market (the one next to Odel), turn right, into Off De Saram Road till you reach the beach. It'll be a short walk towards your left.

name: Dilmah t-Lounge (Arcade)
disc: Dilmah t-Lounge at the Arcade is pretty similar to their outlet in Chatham Street. The food is good, and the space is less crowded but the service isn't great.
address: Shop No. 4, Arcade Independence Square, Colombo 7
