directions: Go down Galle Road, turn into the Cinnamon Grand (past Colpetty Junction). In the Cinnamon, Nuga Gama is downstairs.

name: Milk & Honey Cafe
disc: Milk & Honey has impressive healthy food options, and really pleasant ambience. Also some of the best brownies in the city.
directions: It's right next to the Indian Summer restaurant, opposite the Saskia Fernando Gallery. You'll see a children's store that says 'Milk' - the cafe is right inside at the end.

name: Lucky Star
disc: Even without the exclusively Chinese clientele and waiting staff you'd know it was a mainland restaurant from the quality of the tofu- just softer and silkier than locally-run restaurants can achieve.

name: Hotel De Plaza
disc: This is the citys rising late-night kottu star.
address: Corner of St Anthony's Road and Galle Road, Colombo 3
directions: Down the Galle Road towards Fort, past the Bambalapitiya junction, past  Walukarama Road, and the original Pilawoos.  Opposite 15th lane/the Sumsung store.

name: Currymuch
disc: If you're working around Slave Island or Fort, Curry Much does a decent buth packet with better packaging.
directions: From Union Place, go past the JAIC onto Braybrooke Street. From Gangarama, go down Muttiah.

name: a & m Cupcakes
disc: A&M cupcakes is a charming little cupcake boutique located on the Galle Road, opposite Barefoot. Cupcakes are trendy, tasty little treats - good for eating and even better for instagramming.
directions: It's right opposite Barefoot on Galle Road. The location on gmaps might have a slightly different navigation so be mindful.

name: Cioconat Lounge (CLOSED)
disc: Cioconat offers some tasty, generous fare, but even so it still isnt exactly where it could be.
directions: It's at the corner of Kynsey Road and Barnes Place.

name: Fountain Cafe
disc: Elephant House Fountain Cafe is a photocopy of a once historical watering hole. John Keells bought Elephant House and shut down 'non-performing' brands like the once popular Fountain Cafe, only reopening the place recently. Now the fountain is still there but the cafe is wedged behind a supermarket, literally at the end of aisle 10.
address: Dr Colvin R de Silva Mawatha, Colombo 2
directions: On Union Place, near the Staple Street junction, there's a Keells Supermarket. Walk in and down Aisle 10, or enter from the back.

name: Banana Leaf
disc: They do chicken biryani pretty darn good and now have crab and lamb on the menu.
directions: It's before you get to Barefoot on Galle Road, just before the St. Kilda's Lane turnoff. Big green building.

name: Moon River
disc: Besides one dish, Moon River gave us nothing to be happy about. We honestly cannot recommend it with all the new alternatives in Colombo.
directions: Head down Thimbirigasyaya Road, pass Sen Saal, its on your right before the turning to Fife road.

name: Amrith
disc: Amrith has moved to a new location. The food is still consistent and while they aren't the best in town, they're still a valid option for Indian food.
directions: Right on the corner of Dickmans Road and Havelock Road.Opposite the Police Park.

name: Sweet Tomato
disc: Sweet Tomato Halal Family Restaurant is a decent if slightly expensive option in Pettah, across from the Red Mosque. Down 2nd Cross Street, this clean and friendly establishment serves a decent biriyani at the rather high price of Rs. 400. They also do fried rice and rice and curry.
directions: Head down Main Street into Pettah. You can then walk down (towards the Port). It's at the corner, right across from the mosque.

name: Orchid Restaurant
disc: if youre one of those who've not ventured further into Fort than a night at Dutch-Hos, this is a good place to start.
directions: Exit from the back of the dutch hospital and walk up the lane that takes you past the Steuarts building and Avirate- you'll reach Chatham Street. Turn right its opposite Pagoda Tea Rooms.

name: The Barnesbury
disc: The Barnesbury is another cafe in Colombo. They've got a lovely garden out back, interesting London themed decor and they do an ordinary range of generic Western dishes.
directions: It's on Barnes Place between Wijerama and Kynsey Road junctions.

name: BreadTalk (Lipton Circus)
disc: BreadTalk. We've been there a few times. And on every visit I'm strangely drawn to the polished, round buns, the cheesy breads, the flaky danishes - and each time, I come away disappointed - like a sad, slightly singed moth.
address: Ven Baddegama Wimalawansa Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
directions: From the ODEL roundabout (Lipton Circus) head down Dean's Road (EW Perera) about 50 meters.

name: Paradise Road Cafe
disc: Paradise Road Cafe is one of our favourite haunts, cocooned in a small, white, quiet space atop a lovely store full of antiques and art. The food and coffee are very good, and it's an excellent book nook.
directions: As you go up Dharmapala Mawatha towards Town Hall, pass Cotton Collection too and just after Commercial Bank you'll find the black-and-white striped banners of Paradise Road Cafe on your left.

name: Cafe Michaelangelo
disc: Thin crust, wood-fired pizza, with toppings like Pol Sambol. Michaelangelo is good for delivery, if you're really patient.

name: Echo (Cinnamon Grand)
disc: Colombo wants for good Italian options. While theres no lack of Italian restaurants none of them quite does justice to the real gusti ditalia  Its not that Bayleaf, Il Ponte, Echo are bad exactly  just that they arent quite good enough. On occasion though Colombos wannabe trattorias can surprise you with the quality of their cooking. The other day we stepped into Echo and discovered they serve up a very respectable anti pasti buffet for Rs. 1200+.
directions: Go down Galle Road, past Kollupitiya junction, before Galle Face.

name: Amaravathi Restaurant
disc: Amaravathi is a non-vegetarian South Indian restaurant located on a narrow street off the Galle road, serving great thosas, thalis and one of the country's best biriyanis.

name: The Bridge Restaurant
disc: Located in Kitulgala, the Kitulgala Rest House is just over two hours by car, or about three hours by bus, from Colombo. With a touch of 'old-world charm' the rest house is the perfect place to relax in style after a day of whitewater or hiking in what's fast becoming Sri Lanka's adventure capital
directions: The rest house is about 37km along the A7 (Avissawella-Hatton-Nuwara Eliya) highway. There are several buses that run regularly from Colombo that will stop in Kitulgala. The rest house is well known by locals so don't hesitate to ask for directions if need be.

name: Bo Sevana
disc: All in all it was a decent and quite satisfying meal. If you are looking for a cheap, decent place to get your lunchtime fix, we recommend making the trip.
directions: On the High Level Road, go across the Nugegoda flyover, heading out of town. Bo Sevana is a tiny spot on the right, about 20 meters past the Jambugasmulla Road junction.

name: Paan Paan Sandwich Bar
disc: Paan Paan makes great bread which turns into great sandwiches, melts. etc. It's not cheap but you're getting good, healthy value for money.
directions: From Duplication Road, turn into Queens road (Cricket Club Cafe). It's on the end of the road right on the T Junction there.

name: California Grill (Galadari)
disc: California Grill is one of the city's older fine dining restaurants, located at the rooftop of the Galadari Hotel. They serve a selection of seafood, steak and grills as well as a variety of flambe dishes.

name: LeeSH
disc: A charming little sandwich bar owned by the loveliest couple with delicious food.
directions: Just opposite Bo Sevana on Jambugasmulla Road.

name: Palm Strip (At The Airport)
disc: This has long been among the most exciting restaurants in the city. Not because of its cutting edge cuisine but because, for years, this was the only place to eat at Katunayake (BIA) airport. So a meal at the Palm Strip meant you were going places.
directions: You have to be traveling abroad to go here. Go down the Negombo Road till you get to the Airport turnoff. Once in the Airport, go up the escalator after immigration and it's to your left.

name: Rocco's
disc: Rocco's has a good dine-in restaurant in Rajagiriya serving wood-fired pizza with a wide range of toppings.
directions: From the Battaramulla Road, turn right onto Nawala Road before the Rajagiriya Children's Park.

name: Taprobane (Cinnamon Grand)
disc: Taprobane's dinner buffet is pretty awesome. For just Rs. 2200, the spread's large and the food's top quality. Highlights? Their egg hoppers and their chocolate fudge.
directions: From Galle Road, the Cinnamon Grand is between Galle Face Green and Colpetty Junction. Inside the hotel, walk through the second lobby and downstairs.

name: 88 Chinese Seafood Restaurant
disc: 88 Chinese Seafood Restaurant is a long time player in the local Chinese food scene. It's incredibly popular among b0th locals and Chinese expats, and while it wasn't terrible, it didn't really live up to the hype.
directions: Off Havelock Road, just before the thunmulla round about.  The turn off is a little way past Xilaton, next to La Passion

name: Adma Agro
disc: Adma Agro in Nuwara Eliya is well known for their fresh strawberries and strawberry products. The store itself isn't in the best shape, but thankfully their desserts are still pretty tasty.
directions: Adma Agro is located about 1 km past the Gregory Park (Lake) away from Nuwara Eliya town. It's just past the bridge on a hill to the right.

name: Klassy (Battaramulla)
disc: Short eats in Battaramulla? Klassys is King.
directions: Opposite Wooden Art

name: Hotel Top Form
disc: Hotel Top Form is an Indian restaurant under the Nugegoda flyover. It's OK, the lunch packets are not especially good but we hear good things about the tandoori.
directions: Take the High Level Road out of Colombo, it's just under the flyover, on the right side. You can't turn down there but sometimes you can park under.

name: Panino
disc: Panino makes excellent sandwiches. Filled with tasty ingredients, grilled, prepared with love. If you visit the Good Market each Thursday they're well worth a try. Otherwise they're a good choice for catering or office lunches.

name: The Dutch Bank Cafe
disc: Nestled in a deserted corner of Trincomalee Harbor, The Dutch Bank Cafe, is the first luxury restaurant to be opened since the end of the troubles.
address: 88 Inner Harbour Road, Trincomalee, Sri Lanka

name: Baker Street
directions: From the Panchikawatte Road, go past the Jethawana junction and turn up K. Cyril Perera Road (Bloemendhal). Pass Sugathadasa, the Port Access Road and oil storage. It on the bend near St. James Lane.

name: The Manhattan Fish Market
disc: The Manhattan Fish Market has delicious seafood and ridiculously friendly stuff - it's an awesome place to dine at if you can handle the bill.
directions: From the Liberty Road junction head down Duplication Road, past St. Anthony's Mawatha till Deal Place. You can turn either way to park.

name: The Lavinia Breeze Mount Lavinia
disc: Plant your feet in the sand and watch the waves roll in as the traffic of Mt Lavinia Beach frolic by. Apart from this initial attraction the rest of our experience was somewhat forgettable.
directions: Go down Galle Road to Mount and turn down Hotel Road. At College Avenue turn right. Then take the next big right (De Saram Road) and continue. De Alwis is the fourth street on your left.

name: Alumka Food Cabin
disc: Alumka Caterers have been very successful since they opened up their take out restaurant in Battaramulla several years ago. They offer a variety of food from Rice and Curry and Chinese Fried Rice Packets to Kotthu, Hoppers and even Vegetable Rotti and Wade. Nowadays, come dinner time, you will find their little hole in the wall frenzied by crowds of hungry people.
address: Pannipitiya Road, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
directions: Turn to Pannipitiya Road from Battaramulla Junction, it will be on your Left about 400m down.

name: Chatz
disc: Chatz is a newly opened little cafe in Horton place. They have a crazy range of things to eat - from lamb chops and grilled prawns to mutton kotthu and buriyani (asian) to nachos and fajitas (Mexican). They also do some salads, soups, burgers and pizza; no shortage for choice really.
directions: If you pass coffee bean (on your right) and come down horton place, Chatz is on your left hand side.

name: The Sizzle
disc: Sizzle is an experience restaurant with a great selection of meats and even decent vegetarian. Everything is served sizzling, even the drinks.
directions: Head up Galle Road past McDonald's, Walukarama is the street just after 5th Lane (heading north).

name: Acropol
disc: Acropol Restaurant which formerly resided on R.A De Mel Mawatha has moved to a new location on Galle Road, Colombo 03. If you're a fan of shawarmas it's worth a visit.
directions: On Galle Road, just past Swarna Mahal Jewellers (opposite to Green Cabin), on the sea side. There's a tree which tends to cover the view of the entrance, so keep an eye out.

name: Sen Saal (Battaramulla)
disc: Sen Saal was one of the very first large scale bakeries to establish themselves in Battaramulla. Since then they have added a restaurant at the back where they serve things like Lasgna, Rice and Curry, Nasi Goreng, Fried Rice and even the elusive Lamprais. They also do submarines and fresh fruit juices. Having lived in Battaramulla for so many years now, I was excited about writing a good review to rep the town. But oh my god, this is going to be the furthest thing from a good review!

name: AYU the
disc: AYU the (Ayu branded tea) makes tasty bespoke blends of tea (strawberry, ginger honey, etc). They're available at the Good Market on Thursdays or by delivery. Good either hot or cold.
directions: If it's Thursday, head down the Parliament Road out of Colombo to Waters Edge. They have a stall there. Otherwise call.

name: Maharaja Palace
disc: Maharaja Palace is one of the few fine dining Indian restaurants in Colombo. The prices are high but the portions are actually quite large now. Their food was always pretty good and it seems they've made some necessary improvements.
directions: Turn right to Rajakeeya Mawatha from Thurstan Road, Entrance is on your left.

name: Gecko
disc: Gecko is a restaurant/hotel located on the highly popular main strip of Arugam Bay. They have a great seafront location with chilled out seating and good food, but the service is terrible.
directions: Going along Main Street, Gecko is just past Hideway, before Siam View.

name: La Trattoria
disc: La Trattoria is an Italian restaurant in Battaramulla replacing Coco Citrine. It's very expensive, but the food is decent.
directions: Pass Waters Edge and Sethsiripaya and head into Battaramulla Town. After the Arpico, turn right at the junction (towards Pannipitiya). La Trattoria is about 1 km down the road, before Pasco Food Blush.

name: Yue Chuan (Kingsbury)
disc: Yue Chuan is a fine dining Chinese restaurant located at the Kingsbury hotel. The food is good, but not excellent.
directions: Yue Chuan is on the ground floor of The Kingsbury Hotel.

name: Big Bite (Mount Lavinia)
disc: Big Bite in Mount Lavinia is one of the few places where you can get yourself a proper Pakistani biriyani. It's spicier than most, but it's still damn good, specially coupled with their barbequed chicken.
directions: Proceed along Galle Road south, past Hotel Road and the Cargills/KFC. It's on the corner of Dakshinarama Road.

name: Hideaway Villas
disc: Hideaway is the best restaurant and probably the best hotel in Arugam Bay. It has excellent food and accommodation and thoughtful family management.
directions: Heading down Main Street, Hideaway is across from the big Bay Vista, down from Tri Star and just before Gecko's. It's on the land side.

name: Shanghai Terrace
disc: Shanghai Terrace is a Chinese Restaurant that recently opened up in Ethul Kotte. They serve up some good looking Chinese food at a reasonable price. There is a charming little terrace on the roof top (hence the name Shanghai Terrace) accompanying a slightly dodgy looking bar. The service was really good and the food - not too bad either.
address: 811, Kotte Road, Ethul Kotte, Sri Lanka.
directions: Coming towards Nugogda from Kotte Road, it is on your right.

name: The Vege Way
disc: The Vege Way is one of the latest additions to the clustered stalls of wholesome foods, beverages and knick knacks that is the Good Market.

name: Coffee Stop (Cinnamon Grand)
disc: Coffee Stop at the Cinnamon Grand serves high quality short-eats, sandwiches, cakes and confectionary. It's open til 2 AM every day.

name: SaBaBa's
disc: SaBaBa's is basically the only place on Whiskey Point. It's run by Mambo's brother and is pretty chill. It's underground (no website/Facebook/etc), but if you show up they'll serve you.
address: Whiskey Point, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province
directions: It's a bit of a trek. You'd need to take a trishaw past Pottuvil town, continue on the main road till you see lagoon on your left, then take a right and head towards the beach.

name: Diyawanna Food Court
disc: The Diyawanna Food Court, located in Alcatraz, is a recent development with some of the big names of the fast food culinary scene. The place is essentially just a big car park and probably the best place for kids to ride their bike or try on their roller blades. These days its also become inhabited by shady looking couples whispering sweet nothings to each other.

name: Swyree
disc: Swyree is a little spot near Orr's Hill which serves a great Kottu and fried frice. East coast kottu is different and this place is worth a try.
directions: From Orr's Hill, take the Kandy Road away from town, it's before the petrol shed and across from the vegetables stand.

name: Curve
disc: Curve, at Park Street Mews, is a tapas bar that's been around for a couple of years. While the purple-white theme is looking a bit old now, their tapas and drinks are still pretty good.
directions: From Dharmapala Mawatha, turn down Park Street, past Cotton Collection if you're heading east. Also accessible from Hyde Park Corner, or through Hunupitiya. To Park you pass the Mews, turn left on the next main road, then left again on Lake Crescent, doubling back to the parking lot behind.

name: Rizwan's Wade Cart (Trinco)
disc: On the corner of Dockyard's and St. Mary's (depending) Rizwan runs a good wade cart. He's got manioc chips, fried garlic, and those little wade balls. He's a nice guy, the food is fresh and just different enough from Colombo stuff to be interesting.

name: Korean Barbecue KBQ
disc: KBQ in Rajagiriya does fried chicken and noodles, with a Korean twist.
directions: Head down the Parliament Road through Rajagiriya. This is right past a Perera and Sons' outlet onto your left, and a little way before Pizza Hut.

name: Sweetberry
disc: Sweetberry is a small juice bar which specializes in berries (strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, etc).
directions: From Havelock Road, turn down Dickman's Road and take the second right down De Fonseka. It's about 100m down, past Qbaa. From Duplication Road, you can go up Visaka and right on De Fon or up De Fonseka Place (past House of Fashion) and then onto De Fonseka Rd.

name: Warehouse Project
disc: This stall serves a variety of stuff - from nai miris to pollos cutlets to dim sum. It's all very good.
directions: Head down the Parliament Road till you get to Water's Edge, just before Battaramulla. You'll see the market on your left.

name: Spicy Cabin
disc: We heard good things about Spicy Cabin, but our experience simply wasn't that good.
directions: From Baseline Road, turn down the Nawala Road (opposite Kirula) and pass the bridge. It's after the curve, past the El Cardo. From Nawala take what is then called the Narahenpita Road up about 200 meters.

name: Spice Coast
disc: Spice Coast has good Indian food on Marine Drive. We personally think this is an ideal place for Indian takeaway/delivery and not a bad place to dine in.
directions: Spice Coast is between Holy Family Convent and Majestic City on Marine Drive (closer to Holy Family). The nearest junction is Shrubbery Gardens.

name: Mitsi's Delicacies
disc: Mitsi's Cafe was one of those hidden gems we uncovered in 2013. One year down the line, the food is still good, the service is friendly and the desserts are exceptional.
directions: From Duplication Road, turn left and go up Bagatalle past Charles Place. From Thurstand, turn left at Midnight Divas and take the left fork down Bagatalle, it's near the Malaysian Embassy.

name: Fortaleza
disc: Fortaleza is a nice modern addition to the Galle Fort. They have simple and tasty food, excellent service and a beautiful, hip location. We wish it was in Colombo.
directions: Enter the Galle Fort and turn left at the roundabout (you have to). Continue down Church Street past Amangalla, PAST the Dutch Church and turn right before the All Saints Church. It's at the end of that road.

name: Sisira Bakers
disc: This not-so-little bakery is Ragamas answer to Dinemore, McDonalds, Roots and KFC.
directions: If you're in Ragama, Thewatta Road is the turn near the flyover and the clock tower. Sisira Bakers is right in front of the railway station.

name: Kash's Kitchen (Ambalantota)
disc: Kash's Kitchen is a very clean restaurant and pastry shop in Ambalantota. It serves great rice and curry and short eats at affordable prices.
directions: Driving down the Colombo - Hambantota main road, there will be a vast paddy field to your left just as you're entering Ambalangoda town. Kash's Kitchen will be to your right.

name: Alerics
disc: The old Alerics is finally back with a new location in (the also new) Liberty Arcade. It's a bit artificial, but good for a hot day's treat.
directions: The Liberty Arcade is just past Liberty Plaza, at the beginning of Duplication Road. You can park in the Liberty Parking lot. Inside the arcade, it's basically in the lobby.

name: 41 Sugar
disc: 41 Sugar might be pricier than  other contemporary bars, but both its cocktails and food are honestly excellent. With an excellent rooftop setting to boot, the only thing they really need to fix is the attitude of their staff.
directions: From Horton Place, head down Maitland Crescent at the Coffee Bean. You can't drive to it from the Independence Ave side, but you can park there and walk.

name: Burger King (Mount Lavinia)
disc: To quote the Notorious BIG, it looks like Softlogic is representing BK to the fullest. The Whopper tastes authentic, the service is competent and the location is well equipped and smart. The restaurant doesn't go beyond the usual Burger King flavor, but it's not supposed to. It's very new, but we'd say that this franchise hits the mark.
directions: Head down the Galle Road towards Mt. Lavinia. It's on the seaside past the Arpico and before Hotel Road.

name: Delicieux (Vegan Home Baker)
disc: Delicieux is a vegan home baker based roughly out of Nugegoda. Despite not using milk or eggs, she makes some tasty sweets.
directions: Delicieux sometimes has bake sales at the Amro Cafe in Nugegoda. For regular orders the pick-up is in Borella. Email delicieuxcakery@gmail.com.

name: Upali's
disc: Upali's does affordable and tasty Sri Lankan food.
directions: Upali's is on the road to Town Hall past the Alexandra Roundabout (where Horton Place and Nelum Pokuna meet).

name: McDonald's (Colpetty)
disc: As a food, McDonald's is pretty processed and nothing special, but as an experience it still has a real place in the global psyche. Sometimes you just want McDonald's. In that case the Colpetty outlet serves the usual McD fare with a few Sri Lankan twists.
directions: From Kollupitiya junction, head up Galle Road. It's past Durdan's and around Pilawoos.

name: Cafe Shaze
disc: Cafe Shaze is another one of Colombo's many cafe-restaurant-lounges. They serve the usual Western dishes, mocktails and coffees - the food is alright and it's pretty much on par with other cafes.
directions: From Havelock Road, turn up Thimbirigasaya. It's about 200 meters on your left, right after Calorie Counter.

name: The Chariot (World Trade Center)
disc: There is a Chariot in the World Trade Center and it serves sushi.
address: East Tower, L4, World Trade Center, Colombo 1
directions: The World Trade Center is the biggest building in Colombo, at the end of Galle Face Green, just look for it. Inside, Chariot is one escalator ride above the information desk in the lobby.

name: Dark Temptations (Home Baker)
disc: A worthy and chocolate heavy addition to our reviews of Colombo home bakers. Very tasty and indulgent sweets, mainly brownies.

name: The Brick Lane Cookie Company (Crescat)
disc: The Brick Lane Cookie Companie serves fresh cookies between the escalators of the Crescat Mall. It's a quick and tasty bite you can grab on your way up or down.
directions: You can enter the Crescat Mall from the Galle Road, turning into the Cinnamon Grand (between Galle Face Green and Colpetty Junction) or from the back, going around the Beira Lake. Brick Lane Cookies is in the downstairs food court, between the escalators.

name: Gami Gedara
disc: Healthy and tasty juices for Rs. 200.
directions: On Saturdays, check out the Racecourse via the Independence Square side or by heading from Vihara Maha Devi and down Reid Ave.

name: The Shore By O!
disc: As far as beach bars go, Shore By O! is by far the most popular. Not all their drinks are excellent, but they do the best beer cocktails around and their bites arent too shabby either.
directions: From Galle Road, take Hotel Road towards the Mount Lavinia Hotel. Turn right onto College Avenue. They have some parking at the end of College Ave, or you can park before or down De Saram. Walk to the end of College Ave, cross the rail tracks and you're there.

name: The Paddington
disc: The new address they relocated to is easily accessible and there is plenty of parking. From a food POV, it may not impress everyone but the place sure is somewhere we can all relax at.
directions: The Paddington is on Barnes Place between the Town Hall road and Wijerama Mawatha. It's near Musaeus so watch out for school time.

name: Verandah Bistro & Bar
disc: The Verandah Bistro is a lesser known hotel restaurant on the third floor of the Hilton Residences. It does average hotel food with a nice poolside view.
directions: Head down Union Place (from the ODEL junction) and the Hilton Residences (formerly JAIC) is on your left, past the KFC.

name: Caked
disc: Caked is a home bakery specialising in french macarons, cupcakes and cakes. French macarons are notoriously difficult to master, but they do an excellent job.
directions: Caked currently does pick up. If you follow Havelock Road to where it forks (becoming High Level Road), then go to the right, past the Pizza Hut. Murugan Place is the second road to your right, just past Microimage.

name: Salad Guru
disc: Salad Guru is a fun little new enterprise trying its wings at the Good Market. Run by a trained nutritionist, the stall has a whole range of stuff thats good for you. They range from salads, pastas and soups to quiches and healthy tacos.

name: Kami Maki
disc: Kami Maki is a Japanese fusion restaurant in Bamabalapitiya. While it's not the most authentic Japanese in town, they do offer some interesting fusion dishes.
directions: Kami Maki has moved to Bamba, on Duplication Road you pass AOD and Lauries Road. De Vos is on your right, past Daisy Villa Ave and before Vajira Road.

name: Pedlar's Inn Gelato (Galle)
disc: Gelato down Pedlar's Street
directions: Head to the heart of Galle Fort, Pedlar Street.

name: Cherine's Quench
disc: Started by Cherine Amarasinghe and her husband Karu, Cherines Quench caters bottles of delicious icy beverages  ice coffee, naarang juice, and gingerbeer. Using all natural ingredients and bottled daily, the drinks are fresh and dont contain any additives.
directions: The shop is on your immediate left inside Lakpahana grounds - Lakpahana is just opposite the Racecourse building, which is between the CCC Ground and the University of Colombo.

name: Candy Planet
disc: For candy enthusiasts, Candy Planet in Battaramulla is the holy grail - not only is it affordable but you will find every imaginable type of candy there. It is probably as close as we Sri Lankans will ever get to Willy Wonka's chocolate factory.
directions: Pass the Battaramulla junction and go straight down Kaduwela road - you'll find it at the top of Bogahahena Road.

name: Colombo Courtyard Poolside
disc: Colombo Courtyard's design and style are brilliant, as we've mentioned before in the hotel review. It's chic, it's tasteful, and a lot of it is upcycled. The food, on the other hand, leaves a lot to be desired.

name: Panino (Cotton Collection)
disc: Panino specialises in sandwiches. In melts, to be specific. They also have a killer hot sauce.
directions: Inside the Cotton Collection premises, opposite Vihara Mahadevi Park.

name: Light House Galley
disc: The Light House Galley opposite Colombo Lighthouse is a courtyard-restaurant run by the Navy - it's a good place for lunch or dinner.
directions: Turn into the left-most road at the Kingsbury roundabout, it's right opposite the Lighthouse tower.

name: Gloria Jean's Coffees
disc: (Reopened)Gloria Jean's has made a comeback despite the scandals surrounding their local franchises. They're at Horton Place now where the old Barista used to be, a few steps across the road from Coffee Bean right next to the W Lounge.
directions: It's  at Horton Place across the road from Coffee Bean, next to the W Lounge where the old Barista used to be.

name: Che By Relish
disc: Che By Relish is a lounge/restaurant that serves well prepared food, is on the high-end, and has its walls covered with Che Guevera memorabilia.
directions: Stratford avenue is at the Kirulapone junction, you walk down the road and you'll find it near the huge Gandhara store.

name: Latitude (Buffet, Taj)
disc: Latitude at Taj Samudra offers one of the more expensive lunch buffets in Colombo. While they dont particularly specialise in a particular area, they offer a satisfying spread overall.
address: Taj Samudra, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
directions: Go straight past the Galle Face roundabout (on the Galle Road) and you'll see it on your right.

name: Dinemore (Marine Drive)
disc: Dinemore in Wellawatte by the sea has got their signature oozing-mayo subs and burgers, with a relaxing view of the ocean.
directions: Find Boswell Place on Galle Road, it'll be somewhat opposite the Commercial Bank ATM and Hotel Sapphire. Go down through Boswell Place to Marine Drive and it's right there on the left.

name: Semondu (Dutch Hospital)
disc: Semondu is Sri Lankan airlines' attempt at semi-fine dining (yup, that's a word now). They serve up continental fusion cuisine, and for the most part, they do it well.
directions: It's the first restaurant on your left as you come in through the main entrance at Dutch hospital (opposite the World Trade Center)

name: The Boulevard
disc: The Boulevard, formerly a cafe/restuarant, has been completely revamped into what we'd consider one of the top Thai restaurants in Colombo. With chef Mama (former head chef at Royal Thai) at the fore, as well as some outstanding food, this is one place to keep an eye on.
directions: On Duplication Road turn right on Queen's Road (passing Queen's cafe), The Boulevard is on the left of the lane opposite Divine Bakery.

name: Noodles (Cinnamon Grand)
disc: Noodles at Cinnamon Grand offers one the most complete dining experiences around the city at a surprisingly affordable price point, while maintaining a high level service.
address: Cinnamon Grand Colombo, 77, Galle Road, Colombo 3
directions: Cinnamon Grand is between Temple Trees and Galle Face on the Galle Road. Inside, walk into the lobby, turn right, go past Coffee Stop and the shoe shine place and down the stairs. Keep going forward and it's there.

name: Cafe Orange Peel
disc: Cafe Orange Peel is less of a cafe and more of a very sophisticated bath-kadey - it is a popular new stop for the working crowd in Bambalapitiya. Their rice and curry is top class and comes in epic portions.
directions: It's past the Mothercare showroom, right opposite Ashik and Baskin Robbins.

name: Harbour Court (Kingsbury)
disc: The Kingsbury buffet is pretty good. It's the best in terms of salads and veg, highly competitive in seafood, and good for everything else. It's Rs. 3,500 all in. We think it's good value.
directions: Take the Galle Road north until it ends (past the Galle Face Green) at a roundabout. That giant building you're looking at is the Kingsbury. Go inside and proceed towards the ocean till you get to the restaurant.

name: Empire Cafe
disc: Empire Cafe is a little restaurant-cum-cafe housed inside the Olde Empire Hotel, a 200 year old building, right next to the Dalada Maligawa in Kandy. It's a popular tourist hangout, is surprisingly affordable, and has the best chocolate cake we've had in ages.
directions: Temple Street is off D S Senanayake Street and like the name suggests, very close to the Dalada Maligawa temple. Go down the street, pass Pizza Hut and opposite the flower stalls you'll find a very old looking building titled Olde Empire Hotel on your left.

name: Ginza On The Edge (Waters Edge)
disc: Ginza On The Edge is the suburban successor to the Hiltons  Ginza Hohsen. It's on the 1st floor of Waters Edge and offers high-end Japanese with excellent service to boot.
directions: Come towards Battaramulla on Rajagiriya Road, turn left after the Diyatha Uyana to the Waters Edge Entrance. Walk in up the main stairs and before entering the lobby, turn right, towards the wooden staircase. Ginza is up these stairs, at the end of a long carpet corridor.

name: Mount Lavinia Hotel Buffet
disc: The Governor's Restaurant at Mt.Lavinia Hotel offers one of the better buffets in the city. We found that mostly everything tasted good, with an exceptional salad bar and arguably the best selection of desserts around.
address: No 100, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, turn to Hotel Road (the road that leads down from ODEL), Mount Lavinia hotel is at the very end. Pretty hard to miss.

name: Subway
disc: Swift service and healthy veggie options make Subway a worthy new franchise in Colombo.
address: 347, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
directions: It's just past Mahanama College, on the corner of Walukarama Road and Duplication Road.

name: Streat360
disc: Streat360 is an interesting little restaurant featuring 'street food' from different countries. The interior is quite chic and rustic, but it's kinda overpriced.
directions: Go up Ward Place from the ODEL roundabout, past Cargills, Samsaung and Wijerama Mawatha - you'll find a by-lane on your right marked by the sign 'Streat360'. The restaurant is right at the end.

name: Cafe Asiana
disc: Cafe Asiana is an established affordable restaurant down Hill Street that, as the name suggests, serves Sri Lankanized Asian food - their portions are huge and their seafood is spicy and delicious.
directions: Turn into Hill Street at the Dehiwala junction and keep going - Cafe Asiana is just before Malay Restaurant, on your left.

name: Chutneys  (Cinnamon Grand)
disc: Chutneys serves good South Indian fare, with a menu neatly divided between the four Southern states' vegetarian and non-vegetarian cuisines. The food is quite authentic, with brilliant quality and questionable quantity.
directions: The Cinnamon Grand is on the Galle Road between Galle Face Green and Kollupitiya Junction.

name: Drunken Monkey
disc: Drunken Monkey is a popular restaurant and bar in Hikkaduwa, and one of the couple of places that still function during off-season. The food is average but it's a great place to hang out by the beach.
directions: As you go further South down Galle Road, it's before Narigama Pathana road, on your right - opposite a big white guest house called Le Reve D'Hikka. The Drunken Monkey sign board is next to one that says Hotel International Beach and Restaurant.

name: Sigiri (Manhattan, New York)
disc: Sigiri is a small but excellent Sri Lankan restaurant located in Manhattan, New York serving an authentic and impressive representation of Lankan cuisine.

name: Queen's Cafe
disc: Queen's Cafe is a very popular fast food stop down Duplication Road that's been around for ages. It was closed for a while awaiting a face lift, but it's now open for business again.
directions: It's right next to Fashion Bug, between Queen's Road and the British Council road. It's accessible from Galle Road through Alfred House Gardens.

name: Zion Fountain Cafe
disc: Zion Fountain Cafe is a little bath kade type eatery that's on the same premises as the Zion Christian Church. They serve rice, short-eats, smoothies and cake for affordable prices, and it's actually a pretty popular stop for school-goers in the neighborhood.
directions: Just before you reach Thalakotuwa Gardens on Elvitigala Mawatha, you'll see the big semi-circular sign of the Zion Center on your left.

name: Kandy Muslim Hotel
disc: Kandy Muslim Hotel is not a hotel, but it's a very popular stop for biriyani, kottu and the likes, down the main street at Kandy's center. It's a much bigger, cleaner version of a Colombo kottu kade, and the food is actually pretty good and doesn't cost a lot.
directions: It's almost the first building on Sri Dalada Veediya just after the Clocktower roundabout.

name: Wonderland
disc: Wonderland is an ice cream and smoothie joint in Malabe that has a huge range of stuff on their menu, and it's quite cheap too. Their smoothie glasses are tall and they've got cool flavours like Milo and bubblegum. It is all the way in Malabe though, so all you people in central Colombo, suck it up.
directions: It's right after the Malabe bus stop and Malabe junction, after Pizza Hut - on your left, near the Supul complex.

name: Agra
disc: Agra is another one of those rare fine dining Indian restaurants in Colombo. They're not cheap but we think their food is definitely worth the price.

name: Tang Dynasty
disc: Tang Dynasty  is one of the most authentic ones we've been to, the interior is amazing and the food is top notch.
directions: It's on Dickman's Road, right before the De Fonseka Road turn-off (when coming from Havelock Road).

name: Pranzo (Waters Edge)
disc: Pranzo has an amazing view and serves pretty good Italian and 'Sritalian' fare.
address: 316, Polduwa Rd, Ethul Kotte Road, Battaramulla
directions: Head along the Diyawanna Oya towards Kotte, and turn left just around the Diyatha Uyana white tents. Keep going left till you see the lake of lotus flowers, turn right, and you'll end up at Waters Edge - Pranzo is in the main lobby.

name: Backyard BBQ
disc: Consider yourself a bona fide carnivore? Well then Backyard BBQ is just what you're looking for. They're a barbecue specialist in Mt.Lavinia that does delivery and take-out. They've got a great selection of western barbecue at a pretty good price.

name: Monster Cookies
disc: Monster Cookies is a home baker that does a variety of cookies and since of late, brownies as well. We tried out some of their more interesting choices and we were all smiles.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, Dr. E.A. Cooray Mw is the first lane (seaside) after Arpico. Monster Cookies is at No.10, which is a house at the top of the lane. There's no sign so look for the number.

name: Theva Cuisine
disc: Theva Cuisine is of Kandy's few good restaurants. With great breads, excellent dessert and friendly service, it's definitely worth a visit.
directions: Turn into Keppetipola Road from the main street near Kandy's Central Market - go straight into Hantana Road and follow your Google Map closely as you go up the uphill path. Theva is in the 5th lane on your left. Pass the staircase to the terrace and the restaurant is through the door on your left.

name: Chana's
disc: Chana's has been gaining popularity for sometime now and it's easy to see why. They do a pretty good take on North Indian cuisine and their biriyani is one of the best in town.
directions: Coming down Galle Rd, turn to W.A .Silva Mw. Chana's is about 200m down the road (Before Royal Hospital and Al-Maas).

name: Pedlar's Inn Cafe
disc: Pedlar's Inn Cafe is a popular stop in Galle fort (and so is their Gelato opposite the cafe) - the food is alright, but mostly it's the ambience that makes this place appealing, though there are better spots with better food in the Fort these days.
directions: You can get to Pedlar's Street either from Rampart Street, Hospital Street or Light House Street - it's in the same neighborhood as Barista and Heritage Cafe.

name: Kandoori
disc: Kandoori is an Indian restaurant that serves just biriyani and other Indian food.
directions: Charlemont Road is the lane right before the Savoy theatre - the restaurant is a 10 minute walk in.

name: The Salad Bar
disc: For those looking for healthy food in Colombo, the choices are limited, but The Salad Bar in Rajagiriya is looking to change that. They're a tiny stall that offers a range of salads at affordable rates. The best part is that they actually deliver.
directions: On Parliment Rd, right next to the Keells Super in the same space as Paan Paan and Juiceez.

name: New Star Hotel
disc: The grandly named New Star Hotel is a little street kade on the Galle Road of Dehiwala that serves up a mean iced milo, biriyani and kottu. It's a good stop for a cheap, tasty lunch, if you don't mind the dodginess.
directions: If you're heading in the Bamba-Dehiwala direction, it's on your left, just before St Mary's Church, opposite Crystal supermarket.

name: Pink Sugar
disc: Pink Sugar is a new home baker which remixes classic flavors like  Oreo, Ferrero Rocher and Irish cream.
directions: Pick up is from Nandana Gardens which is almost opposite the Bambalapitiya Flats, and after St Paul's Church Milagiriya.

name: Buth Amma
disc: Buth Amma's Buth Kade is a hole-in-the-wall rice and curry spot in Bamba, run out of a family home for 68 years.
directions: This place is between Romafour and Unity Plaza, on the land side. It's a tiny little lane you might miss unless you're on your feet. Watch out for the hand-painted green sign.

name: The Bread Company (German Artisan Bakers)
disc: The Bread Company does excellent breads, sausages, pickles and more, and they do some of the  best sandwiches in the city and a good breakfast if you want to dine in.
directions: Coming down Thimibirigasyaya Road, past St. Theresa's Church (heading east). Its about 100m past the church, opposite Mas Gourmet (its a grocery store with bright orange paint).

name: Frozen
disc: Frozen is a 'gourmet' ice cream place at Urban Kitchen. The prices are fine and they've got some interesting options on their menu.
address: Arpico Super Store, 69, Hyde Park Corner, Colombo 02
directions: Head down Dharmapala Mawatha along Viharamahadevi Park, and turn left at the Lipton Circus roundabout. Hyde Park Corner is on your first left down this road. Drive into the Arpico premises and when you walk into Urban Kitchen, Frozen is the first stall on your right.

name: Sugar Bistro Galle Fort
disc: Sugar Bistro Galle Fort is a smaller rendition of Sugar Bistro and Wine Bar in Colombo, serving the same great food and drank at a stylish new address at the Galle Dutch Hospital.
directions: Head into Colombo Fort, turn down Queens Street and park at Magistrate's Square. Walk down Hospital Road and there you are.

name: Domenico's
disc: Domenico's, headed by the former chef at Santore was great addition to Colombo's pizza scene in 2014. Now they've expanded their menu with some much needed meats and it's that much better.
directions: Coming down Thimbirigasyaya Rd, past the Fife Rd turn off, Domenico's is opposite wow.lk office (formerly anything.lk)

name: IceBear Century Cafe (Negombo)
disc: Icebear Century Cafe is a very cool place to chill out at in Negombo - it's a quirky hangout and novelty shop in an old house.
directions: If you're heading away from town, you'll find the cafe on your right, down Main Street, after St Mary's Church and the Negombo post office.

name: Treats n Stuff
disc: We've seen their brownies pop up on our news feed more than a few times.  So this time we made it a point to give Treats n Stuff a shot.  We can now see why they've got such a large following.
directions: Coming down Galle Rd (Bamabalapitiya side), St. Peter's place is on sea side past St. Peter's College, juts before the bridge.

name: Giovanni's
disc: Giovanni's is a little Italian pizza place run by a chef who uses his own recipes, and serves fresh from a clay oven.
directions: It's just opposite Moon River Chinese restaurant on Thimbirigasyaya Road, near Sen Saal and Jawatte Road.

name: Aahaara
disc: Aahaara is a caterer that does wood-fired biriyani and rice and curry.
directions: Go down Galle Road towards Dehiwala. Initium Road is the road right opposite St. Mary's Church, on the seaside. Aahaara is situated at the end of this road.

name: Crepeology
disc: A little rooftop spot in the Fort serving up a variety of crepes.
directions: If you're driving best to park near the Lighthouse, along the ramparts (you can take the road along the south side of the Fort and through the Dutch Hospital). Walk up the street past the mosque (Leyn Baan) and it's just after the first junction. In the evenings you go upstairs.

name: CuppaCreme
disc: CuppaCreme is a home baker who is amazing at choc biscuit pudding and red velvet cupcakes.
address: 15A, Robert Road, off Quarry Road, Dehiwala
directions: Robert Road is right off the middle of Quarry Road, near Park Road. It's a five-minute drive into this road.

name: Java Lounge (Bambalapitiya)
disc: We dropped in at the Java Lounge in Bambalapitiya the other day, and it's actually pretty good. They've got an accessible location, good coffee and some awesome desserts.
directions: Coming down Galle Road past the Bambalapitya Flats, Lava Lounge shares the premises with the Kapruka store.

name: The Sweet Tooth
disc: The Sweet Tooth or TST, is a small home baker that specializes in jars full of baked goods. We tried a bunch of different jars (along with some other stuff) and they were all pretty great.
directions: TST will let you know the address and directions when you place the order.

name: The Sweeter Side
disc: The Sweeter Side is another home baker - the prices are fine, the cakes are a bit bread-texture, we like the fudge brownies.
directions: It's close to the Open University just before the bridge.

name: Ambrosia
disc: Ambrosia does baked goodies, but they're not a home baker. They're a company, but the stuff we had was made by a very skilled hand and given the special attention that only home bakers are known to give.
directions: This road is just past the Borella junction and Punchi Theatre.

name: Mayura Hotel
disc: Mayura Hotel serves great rice and curry on banana leaves, and excellent Jaffna crab.
directions: Sri Kathiresan Street is very near the Central Gold Market in Pettah, it's just a skip away from the Main Street roundabout. Walk down from that end and you'll find it on your right.

name: Anzu's Restaurant (Huang Xiang Ju)
disc: Anzu's restaurant on Marine Drive (Colpetty) is a new and authentic Chinese eating house. While it may not suit everyone, it's a good option for those looking to experience Chinese home cooking.
directions: Anzu's Restaurant is on Marine Drive right before Hotel Sun Hill and Palmyrah Av (even though it says it's on it).

name: Sweet Layers
disc: Sweet Layers is a home baker based in Piliyandala. They offer a range of baked goods, but their pastries are what really sets them apart.
directions: Sweet Layers is past the Bokundara junction and Food city, turn to Nilani Gardens. It's small lane next to a big blue building. It's house No. 2 down the lane.Best bet is to call them and get directions from Bokundara junction.

name: Tong Ni BBQ
disc: Colombo has a ton of Chinese eateries, but Tong Ni BBQ hidden away on Walukarama Road (behind Subway), is one that is truly unique. The food is good and you get to see it being cooked right on your table. It may not suit everyone but we found it entertaining.
directions: Coming down Duplication Rd past Mahanama College, turn to Walukarama Road ( Road next to Subway). Tong Ni BBQ is at the back of the road right in front of the Walukaramaya Raja Maha Viharaya.

name: McDonald's Delivery (McDelivery)
disc: We order from McDonald's far more than we probably should, but that's because their delivery is efficient, reliable and quite fast!

name: The Brick Lane Cookie Company (Fort)
disc: The Brick Lane Cookie Company opened up their newest stall in Fort a couple of weeks ago. We tried a bunch of their cookies along with their interesting new additions, and they were all pretty great.
directions: Brick Lane is at the entrance of the Colombo City Hotel, right opposite the WTC.

name: The Spectrum
disc: The Spectrum, formerly known as the Coco Fresh Bar, is a small waffle bar at the Liberty Arcade. The waffles are quite ordinary but they do a solid Milo shake.
directions: From the Colpetty Junction turn right to Duplication Rd at the Liberty Roundabout. The Spectrum is on the ground floor of the new Liberty Arcade.

name: Infinity Cuisine
disc: Affordable and pretty tasty office lunches, with free delivery.
address: 536/15, Wijesinghe Gardens,  Kotte Road, Pita Kotte
directions: It's delivery, so they come to you.

name: Prego
disc: Prego is an Italian restaurant in Negombo. Although the prices are high, the food is quite authentic and the ambience is chilled out.
directions: The restaurant is down Lewis Place, near Jetwing Ayurveda. It's right next to that weird Negombo roundabout with the sculpture of two dolphins and a crustacean.

name: Krishna (Arcade Independence Square)
disc: Krishna is a good vegetarian spot for rice and curry and the likes at the Arcade. They're run by the same guys who run Mathura.
directions: The Arcade is before you get to BMICH, after the SLBC building, on your left. The entrance fountains opposite the post office are hard to miss. Inside, the food court is near where the fish tank floor is.

name: Cakes & Things By Windya (Mt.Lavinia)
disc: Cakes & Things by Windya is a home baker in Mount Lavinia. Her specialty is theme cakes, but her cupcakes and brownies are pretty great as well.
directions: From Galle Road turn to Templers Road in Mount Lavinia. Cakes & Things is on Kalapura Rd, at the end of Templers Rd.

name: Grand Beijing
disc: Grand Beijing is another Chinese place around the Kollpity junction that serves up good, authentic dishes at affordable prices.
directions: Turn right at the Kollpity junction, pass the Liberty Cinema, and just after Dinemore you'll see the restaurant's big yellow board on your right.

name: Indian Summer
disc: Indian Summer is a slightly expensive Indian restaurant, with a great ambience.
directions: It's a few minutes from Coffee Bean and Barista, and opposite the Saskia Fernando Gallery.

name: China Town
disc: China Town is a little restaurant on Marine Drive that serves big sloppy portions of spicy Sri Lankan-Chinese and even some Indian.
directions: Sea Avenue on Galle Road is near Nations Trust Bank and The Fab. Chinatown is on the street's Marine Drive end.

name: Itsy Bitsy Cupcakes
disc: Itsy Bitsy Cupcakes is another home baker and they're big on covering their cupcakes with huge dollops of icing.
directions: They deliver

name: Health Factor
disc: Health Factor is an awesome little restaurant in Kohuwala that cooks up very tasty but healthy meals - at great prices.
directions: The restaurant is in the same building as the High Octane Fitness Gym - near Lumala City and Kushmi, a few minutes away from the bridge.

name: Jeorgie's Healthy Style Food
disc: Jeorgie's is a new burger place in Nawala - the burgers are huge (and not so healthy), and the fruit smoothies are amaze.
directions: School Lane on Nawala Road is just past Keells Super and the Nawala Cemetery. Go in and you'll see a big board that says 'Fun Factory' on your left - walk in here to get to Jeorgie's.

name: Dolce Italia
disc: Dolce Italia is a new little bakery cum restaurant run by two Italians. They serve pastries and Italian favourites that are both authentic and affordable.
directions: The new location is on Skelton Road, just off Dickman's Road.

name: The Tuna & The Crab
disc: The Tuna & The Crab is a mainly Japanese restaurant run by Sri Lanka's top chef Dharshan Munidasa in the Galle Fort. The quality is reliable but not game-changing, and the prices are high.
address: Galle Dutch Hospital, Hospital Street, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: If you're entering the Galle Fort, it's quickest to go through the southern gate. Turn left onto Court Square and keep going, there's parking behind the Galle Dutch Hospital.  If you're coming through the center gate, take the detour down Church Street, turn onto Queens St and then through the square.

name: Top Secret Beach Restaurant (Hikkaduwa)
disc: Top Secret is a very cool beach hangout in Hikkaduwa. We loved the ambience and the food is good without  being too pricey.
directions: It's on the Galle Road beach stretch, near the International Beach Hotel and Blue Moon.

name: Sherry Land Restaurant & Pub
disc: Sherry Land is a restaurant and pub in Negombo that offers one of the best cocktail menus we've come across in recent times, with some good food to boot.
directions: Sherry Land is about half way down Porutota Rd, past the Jetwing Ayurveda Pavilion but before Jetwing Blue.

name: Burger Queen
disc: If you thought you'd tried the entire local burger monarchy, think again, cause we just found Burger Queen. It may not blow your mind, but they've got some interesting additions along with the usual favourites.
address: No. 98, Sri Saranankara Road, Kalubowila, Dehiwala
directions: Burger Queen is on Saranankara Rd before Sumandisi bakers, just past the Anjaneyar Temple turn off.

name: Euphorium
disc: Basically a place to have tea with a sweet Japanese auntie. They also sell well-chosen tea leaves. No food unless she gives you a biscuit.
directions: This is on a tiny residential lane off of Kynsey Road, near the De Saram Rd. junction. You can either come De Saram near the National Hospital/Central Hospital or go all the way down Kynsey. Once you pass De Saram it's the first unnamed street (should say 3-17). Walk down and look for 3-14. There's a teddy bear inside.

name: Cafe Francais by Pourcel
disc: Cafe Francais is the only and best French restaurant in Colombo. It's expensive but really high quality dining.
directions: It's at the top of Park Street Mews. From Dharmapala Mawatha, turn down Park Street across from Vihara Maha Devi Park. Do a bit of a loop around for parking.

name: Saffron and Vanilla
disc: Saffron and Vanilla is a home baker with international experience - she makes some amazing date cookies, and runs cookery classes.
address: 91/16B, Midland Mawatha, Wattarappala Road, Mount Lavinia
directions: Wattarapala Road is just before Cargills Food City, on your right, if you're heading from Colombo to Mount. Go right in to the very end of the road and after De Silva Road, turn left. The house is at the end of this lane.

name: Life Food
disc: Life Food is a low key health food stall that manages to keep things healthy and fresh while not compromising on flavour.
directions: Life food is located at the Good Market shop in Lakpahana, which is just opposite the Colombo Racecourse building.

name: Saffron Persian Delights (Good Market)
disc: Saffron is a popular Iranian stall at Thursday's Good Market in Battaramulla. They serve some great Persian favourites, both sweet and savoury.
address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Colombo Racecourse, Colombo 07
directions: The Good Market is in the car park almost right behind the Racecourse mall. You can't miss the green tents, just look around for this stall.

name: Jeewa's Polos and Kuma's Natural Foods
disc: Jeewa's is a great place at the Good Market to have some proper Sri Lankan wraps, roast paan or roti, for cheap.
address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Colombo Racecourse, Colombo 07
directions: The Good Market is in the car park almost right behind the Racecourse mall. You can't miss the green tents, just look around for this stall.

name: House Of Biriyani
disc: House of Biriyani is a new biriyani delivery and take out in Kalubowila. They offer good value for money along with a solid roast chicken, but they also have room for improvement.

name: Bombay Sweet Park (Bambalapitiya)
disc: Bombay Sweet Park is a small easily accessible shop in Bamba that does very good samosas and milkshakes - they've also got sweets and rice and curry.
address: 225, Visakha Road (at the Galle Road end), Galle Road, Colombo 04
directions: Visakha Road is almost opposite Holy Family Convent and parallel to Pilawoos. This shop is right at the top of this lane if you're coming in from Galle Road.

name: Foodie Adventure
disc: Foodie Adventure is a home cook in Nawala that does take away and delivery. We tried a bunch of her stuff and pretty much all of it was amazing. Which isn't something we say often.
directions: Foodie Adventure  is Malwatta Rd, off Nawala Rd just a bit past the Machan.

name: Brownie Lovin'
disc: Brownie Lovin' is one of Colombo's awesome brownie bakers. The brownies are extremely gooey and chocolatey, and affordable.
directions: Harischandra Mw is off Havelock Road, near the end of WA Silva Mw, opposite St Peter's Church. Once you enter the road, the house is in the first by-lane on your left.

name: Calorie Counter
disc: Calorie Counter with its emphasis on healthy eating was one of the best new additions to Colombo's restaurant scene in 2015. Now they've gone a  step further and introduced a pretty comprehensive breakfast menu, most of it actually tastes pretty great.
directions: Calorie Counter is on Thimbirigasyaya, just up from Havelock Road. It's before the Fab on Siripa Rd, right opposite the Glory Swim Shop.

name: Mango & Company
disc: Mango & Company is yet another new home baker. What sets M & G apart is their cinnamon rolls which are some of the best we've had in Sri Lanka.

name: Tammy's
disc: Tammy is a Colombo home baker that specializes in some unconventional cakes. Her repertoire includes bibikkan, love cake and juggery cake, all of which were excellent.
directions: Tammy's is down Haig Rd (closer to the Marine Drive end), right next to the Indian Chaat Corner.

name: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf (Liberty Plaza Podium)
disc: Coffee Bean is slowly turning into Colombo's next Barista - this is the third branch to pop up in the city at another very central location. The coffee and food here taste alright and are pricey as usual, and it's a comfy quiet place to chill out at.
address: First Floor, Liberty Plaza Podium, Colombo 3
directions: This is on the 1st floor of the Liberty Plaza Podium - you can get here directly via escalator. The Podium is a big glass extension of the old Liberty Plaza building, which is right opposite Liberty Cinema. You need to turn right from Galle Road at the Kollupitiya junction to get here.

name: Pho Vietnam
disc: Pho serves up simple and healthy Vietnamese food. It's not as flavorful as we'd like, but they're very new and we think they'll improve.
directions: Pho is on Thimbi between Havelock Road and Jawatta. It's actually in from the road a bit, right next to Calorie Counter.

name: rare at Residence (Uga Residence)
disc: Expensive, but probably the most modernist Sri Lankan cuisine you can get.
directions: From Dharmapala Mawatha, head down Park Street and past Park Street Mews and Cafe Francais. It's just before the roundabout.  You can also get to the roundabout from the Gangaramaya Temple side.

name: Flavoured (Cinnamon Red)
disc: Flavoured at Cinnamon Red, with their lean luxury theme, offers a curated menu with good variations at reasonable prices. They've got a good view of Colombo, tasty mains and excellent desserts, albeit with slightly slow service.
directions: Red is at the end of Green Path (Nelum Pokuna Road), at the corner of Flower Road. If you go further down the road you hit Liberty Plaza. It doesn't look like it, but it has plenty of parking.

name: Thai Heritage (Galle Dutch Hospital)
disc: Thai Heritage is one of the many chic little restaurants on the foyers of the Old Dutch Hospital building in the Galle fort. The food though not striving for authenticity, is still alright, and somewhat on par with most fancy diners in the fort.
address: 1st Floor, 10-02, Old Dutch Hospital, Hospital Street, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: You can get to the old Dutch Hospital building through different routes - one is through Queens Street. As you enter the Fort, turn left, into Church Street, then turn left again into Queens Street - keep going down this road till you reach the building.

name: Dilan's Crab
disc: A simple home cook that serves shelled crab - a real pleasure to eat.
directions: Delivery

name: Fresheta
disc: Fresheta is a small juice bar at the top of Chithra Lane. They serve up some refreshing, tasty juices which really hit the spot on a scorching day.
directions: Fresheta is at the very top of Chithra Lane, as you turn in from Kirula Road.

name: The Ceylon City Hotel
disc: The Ceylon City Hotel is one of the newer new age hotels in Colombo. It's got good facilities at decent prices.
directions: When passing Visaka Road on Galle Road look to your left. Upatissa Road is the second lane on your left.

name: Nordic House (Hikkaduwa)
disc: Really tasty burgers, but not cheap.
directions: Nordic House is near Chaaya Tranz, before Mambo's on the Galle Road. It's NOT where Google Maps say it is. From Colombo

name: The Colombo Cafe
disc: The Colombo Cafe  is a new competitor in Colombos cafe square off. While the prices of sandwiches and shakes can put your wallet on the endangered list, their Sri Lankan Buffet deal is the best deal weve come across.
directions: Where Lotus Road meets York Street, turn left onto Chatham St. These guys are next to the Dilmah T House.

name: Poonie's Kitchen
disc: Poonie's Kitchen is a wonderful hidden oasis in the Galle Fort. They serve high quality desserts and deliciously prepared dishes at surprisingly good prices.
directions: This is just a few feet from Pedlar's Inn Cafe - you have to walk through two sets of doors (through the Mimimango shop) to get to Poonie's.

name: The Dodol House
disc: Dodol is a difficult dessert to find easily in Colombo shops - so we were ecstatic to find one that not only makes some but delivers dodol to your home.

name: Grandpila Family Restaurant
disc: Pilawoos, the biggest players on Colombo's kottu scene, have set up a bigger, more family friendly restaurant on Marine Drive. The kottu and iced milo are still stellar.
directions: Turn into Palmyrah Avenue from Galle Road (it's two lanes after Barefoot), and you'll find it on Marine Drive on your right.

name: Barista Lavazza (Laksala Museum Gallery Cafe)
disc: Barista is the biggest coffee shop franchise in Colombo. Though their Laksala branch is just as so-so as the others in terms of food and drinks, it's got a lovely park-like ambience.
directions: It's at the end of a long lane (marked by 'Barista' and 'Laksala' signboards), nextdoor to Nelum Pokuna Theatre, opposite Viharamahadevi Park.

name: Anna Marie Bakery
disc: The Anna Marie Bakery sounds like a place from a Beatrix Potter book. The food might as well be from the books too.
directions: Since pick-up is from her home I reckon you call her and get the address

name: Grand Thai (Grand Hotel, NE)
disc: Grand Thai is a relatively new Thai restaurant which resides at the former basement of The Grand Hotel. Taking the experience as a whole, we were very impressed. Good food, beautiful interior and some impeccable service.
directions: Turn into Grand Hotel Rd from the Victoria Park roundabout and make your way up about 100m. Grand Thai is located in the basement of The Grand Hotel.

name: Rripe Juice Bar
disc: Rripe is an okay juice bar that offers juices and fruits that are locally grown.
directions: Turn into Marine Drive from Galle Road onto Carlwil Place. Ripe is just there after the turn to the right.

name: Harpo's Pizza (Nugegoda)
disc: Harpo's has a new stand-alone pizza parlor in Nugegoda. Almost by default it's one of the nicer places in that town now, and it makes for faster delivery to the suburbs - from Kotte to Battaramulla.
directions: The branch is near the Jubilee Post Roundabout. From Nugegoda, take the main road past the Nugegoda Supermarket towards Kotte. At a fork in the road (where Meat Locker is) turn right. Continue on that road for a few kilometers.

name: Praneetha
disc: Praneetha is a small eatery that serves up a great rice and curry with the option of every kind of meat, from prawns to pork.
directions: From the junction where Perahara Mawatha meets Hudson Road just walk into Hudson Road a few feet and turn left from the junction in to Muhandiram's Road and you'll find it on the left.

name: Galle Caterers
disc: Galle Caterers are one of the older caterers in Colombo with quite a large customer-base. We've tried their stuff on numerous occasions and they offer great value for money on top of consistent taste.
directions: Turn to Kadawatha Road from Hill Street and keep on it for a bit less that 1 km.  Galle Caterers is opposite the Vishnu Kovil Road.

name: Room Service Deliveries
disc: Room Service is one of the more efficient delivery services around. Their delivery charges are higher than most others but they deliver from some high profile restaurants that you can't get otherwise.

name: Trainspotter (Global Towers Hotel)
disc: Trainspotter at Global Towers is one of the few restaurants that's open 24 hours a day. Unfortunately, the entire experience is mediocre at best.
address: 11, Global Towers Hotel, Marine Drive, Wellawatta, Colombo 06
directions: Global Towers is on Marine Drive, just a few meters past the KFC (next to Charlemont Road).

name: Curry Leaf (Hilton)
disc: Curry Leaf is the Hilton's Sri Lankan restaurant, and their spread of local cuisine and fresh seafood is top notch. If you can afford the taxes, this is a must try.
directions: Past Galle Face Green, turn right at the Kingsbury roundabout and pass Galadari. You'll see Hilton on your left as you head towards Fort.

name: Indramalee
disc: Indramalee is a little buth kade on Union Place that does good rice and curry and fruit juices.  It's not much for ambience but the fare is reliable.
directions: It's just on the left side of Hilton Residencies.

name: FLOW (Hilton Colombo Residences)
disc: FLOW is a restaurant at the Hilton Residences that serves up  a variety of international and local cuisines.
directions: HCR is next to Staple Street down Union Place. You have to walk into the Staple Street side entrance of the hotel to get to FLOW.

name: Cafe Chill
disc: This is truly a chill spot with beanbags, good food, decent WiFi and really smart and friendly staff.
directions: It's on the main road in Ella, past the rail tracks and just before Dream Cafe.

name: Waves
disc: Waves is so good Id rather it be a secluded seafood jewel tucked at the bottom of Fairline road. The portion are generous and the fares are reasonable.
directions: Leg it to the bottom of Fairline Road till you come to a dead end at the railway tracks. It should be on the shore to your right.

name: Tatlers Tea
disc: Tatlers Tea is the usual YAMU tea break spot. It really isn't anything to write home about, but if you visit you just might bump into us!
directions: Head down Vajira Road and onto Duplication. Continue down Duplication- Tatlers is just before the turn off on Visakha Road to your  right.

name: Macky's Restaurant
disc: Macky's is a decent choice for big portions and sloppy, spicy Sri Lankan Chinese, pastas and meats.
directions: It's past the Kirulapone market, opposite the Jumma Mosque.

name: Mount Grill
disc: Mount Grill is an old restaurant in Mount Lavinia that serves a lot of Sri Lankan favorites. The place looks pretty run down now, but the food is actually quite good, especially some of their meat dishes.
directions: Mount Grill is on Galle Road, past the Mount Lavinia Cemetery, just before the IOC gas station.

name: Sea Fish Restaurant & Bar
disc: Sea Fish is a restaurant that's been around since the '70s, and its dining space still features music and lights from that era. Their seafood is however good, and they also do seafood BBQs in their backyard on request.
address: 15, Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
directions: You'll find it down a small lane right next to Regal Cinema, a little walk away from Lake House.

name: & Co. (The Steuart)
disc: &Co is a new pub and restaurant tucked in the Steuart Hotel behind Dutch Hospital. They serve up good, hefty pub fare in a spacious setting.
address: 45 Janadhipathi Mw, Colombo 1 (entrance on Hospital Ln)
directions: Walk through Dutch Hospital, exit past Barefoot and Taphouse, and the hotel will be immediately on your left. From Chatham Street, you can turn down Hospital Lane. Parking is hit or miss. Honestly, take a cab.

name: Royal Burger
disc: Royal Burger is a very reliable stop on Havelock Road for cheese dripping, affordable burgers and subs. It's a popular lunch option among the RI students in the neighborhood.
directions: This is right opposite Royal Institute, near Havelock City.

name: Royal Bakery
disc: Royal Bakery is an old timer from Colombo's original bakery scene, going way back to 1906. The shorteats and cakes are still pretty good, and they've expanded to serving rice and kottu too.
directions: It's right next to No Limit, opposite St Lawrence Road.

name: Zephyr (Arugam Bay)
disc: Zephyr is a branch of the Mirissa spot. They do quite good food and drinks here.
address: Siam View Hotel, Panama Road, Arugam Bay
directions: Zephyr is literally tucked behind Siam House near the curve of Panama Road, before Main Point. It's after Gecko.

name: Seoul
disc: Seoul is a bright, sunlit, spanking new addition to the (mostly cheerless) Korean restaurants in the city.
directions: Right before the Lakshman Kadirgamar Institute when you're heading down Horton Place towards Nelum Pokuna

name: Navratna (Taj)
disc: Navratna, the Taj's Indian restaurant, is one of the few great places in the city for an authentic Indian dining experience.
address: 25, Taj Samudra Hotel, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
directions: Taj is right opposite Galle Face. Walk into the main lobby and turn into the corridor on your right to get to Navratna.

name: Chop Chop Kottu
disc: Chop Chop does tasty, generous kottu all day, via drive through or delivery. Win.
directions: Chop Chop is part of Gonuts, which is at the corner of Horton Place and Kynsey Road. You can enter via Kynsey Road from the  north side or via Horton Place heading east, out of Colombo.

name: Hotel New Amirthaa
disc: A YAMU office favourite, Amirthaa in Bamba does a mean Ghee dosa. It also serves Bonda, Jelebi and fresh milk with a dash of tea.
directions: It's on Galle Road, land side, right after you pass the Vajira Road turn-off and the Kovil.

name: The Cake Factory (5th Lane)
disc: The Cake Factory has opened a small cafe on 5th Lane that offers a slightly limited range of their cakes and desserts. The cakes were so-so, but their cheesecake was the real winner.
directions: Cake Factory is on 5th Lane, just a few metres past Cafe on the 5th.

name: The Grand  Espresso Bar
disc: The Grand is a little coffee shop along the bustling  Colombo Road in Negombo. They serve really good drinks and some killer cheesecake for very decent prices.
directions: If you're heading towards Negombo from Colombo, it's a little way off Maris Stella College. There's a Ranjana's clothing store right opposite.

name: King Coconut
disc: The King Coconut has a tropical vibe  with its roof dotted with coconut fronds and bamboo fences all round. It's also very chilled out, with a great view of the sea and the wind whipping around.
directions: As you go north along the Puttalam-Colombo highway, keep to your left and turn to Porutota Road. Drive along Porutota Road until you pass the Jetwing Ayurveda Pavilions.  You'll find the King Coconut Family Restaurant a few metres away, on your left.

name: BreadTalk (Park Street)
disc: BreadTalk has been doing well since its inception despite all the "its-expensive!" cries, but anything for a posh pastry, right?
directions: Head down Park Street and pass Park Street Mews and Crown. BreadTalk is at the confusing roundabout to your right. Turn into the car park and head all the way down.

name: Dolce Vita
disc: Dolce Vita is a rustic and snug little Italian restaurant / cafe which serves everything from breakfast menus to snazzy drinks, pizzas and gelato.
directions: Few meters from Rodeo Pub, at the end of a small path. Look for their black sign on Poruthota Road.

name: MOMO
disc: MoMo's has an extensive menu ranging from naans to lasagna to seafood and pastas. It has a nice, comfy interior, and is a vibrant space for families.
directions: Just past Peliyagoda, and right opposite the Nawaloka Playground in Oliyamulla. It's onto your left, you can't miss it.

name: Oshella
disc: Oshella is a home cook who specializes in chocolatey desserts. Literally everything we tried was excellent, but her eclairs in particular were the best we've had in Colombo.

name: La Langousterie
disc: La Langousterie is a beachside restaurant in Mount Lavinia that's pretty difficult to find. It's not the most sophisticated spot as far as ambience goes, but they offer a varied menu and some decent seafood dishes.
directions: La Langousterie is on Mount Beach at the far end. It's basically the closest restaurant to the Mount Lavinia Hotel on the beach.

name: The Dining Room (Cinnamon Lakeside)
disc: The Dining Room specializes in international buffets at Cinnamon Lakeside.
address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115, Sir Chittampalam A.Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 02
directions: It's just before the SL Air Force headquarters.

name: Thinesh Bake House
disc: You'll be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the breads, biscuits and baked goods at this Jaffna bakery and cafe.
directions: The bakery is on Sivaprahasam Road, just down the road from an outlet of Cargills Food City.

name: B's Delights
disc: B's Delights is relatively new, having started up just a couple of months ago. They do cakey brownies with interesting twists.
address: Delivery or pick up from Dehiwela or Bambalapitiya
directions: It's delivery

name: McDonald's (Welisara)
disc: There's a McDonald's outside of Colombo as well.
directions: Drive along the Negombo Road until you pass Mabola. It's about a couple of kms from the Mabola Mosque  you can't miss those giant golden arches.

name: The Fab (Wattala)
disc: Fab is one of the older and more established bakeries in town. The franchise is well known for its cakes.
directions: When you're driving out of Colombo on the Negombo road, it's just opposite Hemas Hospitals, and a little before the Hendala Junction.

name: Atrium Restaurant
disc: Atrium is a Japanese/Fast Food restaurant in Thalawathugoda
directions: If you're on the Battaramulla - Pannipitiya Road, turn towards Madiwela from Thalawathugoda. Atrium will be about half a kilometre in, on your right, just at the start of the walking track.

name: Sri Suryas
disc: Crammed into a congested street in Pettah, Sri Suryas is an unassuming restaurant that serves a mean ghee dosa, among other things.
directions: Go down Bodhiraja Mawatha from the main road, and when you reach the Main Street roundabout at the end, turn into Sea Street. Keep going a few hundred metres past all the jewellery shops until you see the Kathiresan kovil on your left. Sri Suryas is situated right next to the temple, across the road from New Saraswati Cafe.

name: Cool Berry
disc: Cool Berry is where the Juice Bar used to be. Despite their name and the extensive range of juices and smoothies on the menu, they don't have half of it.
directions: If you're coming from Maradana towards Borella, take a right turn soon after passing Aquinas.

name: Far East Indonesian Cuisine
disc: From regulars like Nasi Goreng and Mee Goreng, this place also dishes out a pretty great beef rendang.
directions: You can find this almost right at the top of Vauxhall Street if you're coming from the Ibbanwala Junction side. Closest landmarks are APIIT, Hyde Park, and the Arpico Supercentre.

name: Margie's Kitchen
disc: Margie's Kitchen is a home cook in Mount Lavinia that specializes in Dutch Burgher and Portuegse influenced local dishes. While they offer a variety of dishes, most of it revolves around pork, and their briliant black pork curry is the coup de grace.
directions: Huludagoda Road is down Sri Gunerathne Mw off Galle Rd.  This isn't a restaurant so give them a call for the exact location for pick up.

name: Grande Gourmet at Nirj's
disc: Try-hard decadence that's not worth your money. Faux fine dining.
directions: From the Nelum Pokune roundabout, turn onto Horton Place.

name: Seasons
disc: Authentic biryani at affordable prices, Seasons is only held back by its dismal setting on the deserted second floor of Liberty Plaza.
address: Liberty Plaza, Level 2, 250, R A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
directions: Turn onto Duplication Road from the Liberty Plaza roundabout. Take the elevator to the second floor. It's to your right.

name: Coco Veranda (Crescat Boulevard)
disc: Coco V at Crescat offers the same stuff as the Coco V at Ward Place, but the ambience isn't as chilled out as the other. Their signatures are coffees and cakes.
address: G-09, Crescat Boulevard, Galle Road, Colombo 03
directions: It's on the same floor as the Vijitha Yapa Bookstore at Crescat  just outside, onto your right as you exit the building.

name: Senkada Salaka Restaurant
directions: Turn right into Union Place from Lipton Circus (near Town Hall). It's almost right at the start, on your left. Parking is available but super limited.

name: The Fab (Moratuwa)
directions: The Fab's on Galle Road, right across from the main gates of Prince of Wales Collage, Moratuwa

name: London House of Coffee
disc: London House of Coffee is a new coffee shop located on Gregory's Road serving Ceylon Coffee - roasted in-house.

name: Sheherazade Arabic Restaurant (Galadari)
disc: They have okay-ish food, and have an Arabian-Nights-esque deco going on, but have room for vast improvement.
address: Galadari Hotel, Ground Level, Fort, Colombo 01
directions: Cut straight across the lounge, passing a couple of other restaurants and seating areas. This is right at the back of the hotel.

name: Governor's Restaurant (Mount Lavinia Hotel)
disc: The Governor's Restaurant at the Mount Lavinia Hotel is one of the few hotel restaurants that offers real value for money with their dishes.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, turn to Hotel Road (the road that leads down from ODEL), Mount Lavinia hotel is at the very end. Pretty hard to miss.

name: Sushi Kai
disc: Sushi Kai is the new Japanese restaurant that's taken up the former location of Kami Maki. It may look familiar, but they fall well short when it comes to flavour and quality.
directions: Sushi Kai is at the Jawatte Road junction in Thimibirigayaya, right opposite the Church of the Good Shepherd.

name: The Pudding Stop
disc: A new place which specializes in biscuit puddings.
directions: Joseph Lane is near the Bamba Junction. Turn in and go towards Junior George's. Call them for pickup directions.

name: Elite (Wattala)
